review: Consistency, quality and personablity describe this Red Robin. The staff here is vetted by management, trust me I've been coming to this one for years, the staff that doesn't have the manners, courtesy, etc... are often short lived here.

Me and my bf first time eating here and it was a nice customer service no wonder they always have a lot of people coming and coming ,we also got a small fries for free. Our servers name is Dalia she's very nice and shes good at customers and i love it

Ate there today... was excited that they  have this tablet that you can order youself and pay on the device... we tried the verry berry drink and oreo shake, that was good :) then our food came we ordered blue ribbon burger, medium rare. Meat was burnt at the bottom :( you can taste the bitterness of it, so that was not good. Waiting for our water and drinks to get refilled but we needed to get their attention before we got our refill. Then time to pay.... so we were excited to use the tablet but after swipping the card it said our check can't be processed right now. We tried it 3x still no go. We asked help with our server but still didnt work so we end up just paying the regular way. Food wasnt that bad just the burnt part... usually we dont get that but service was a little slow for sure.

I've been coming to red robin for over ten years and this is the first time the server was trying to charge $1.99 for fries to start off with. Guess it's not really bottomless anymore. There are many times I order their onion rings, burgers, salads, freckled lemonade, dessert, among other things that I was just craving some fries as a starter. So I was taken back when she told me of this cost. Goes against their advertising, I think. But anyway.. My current favorite salad is their fiesta salad. Their A1 peppercorn burger is also good. The fire burger is okay.  Their smoke and pepper tastes the best there.  Their wraps are disgusting.  Freckled lemonade is a must.  Milkshakes are always a win.  Onion rings are to die for.

Great food, decent prices, i really like how they offer lettuce instead of buns for burgers.  Their beer selection is limited,  didnt hear of any "happy hour" specials but overall a cool spot, i would definitely go again.

I would have to say they are my favorite when it comes to burger and desserts. I also tried the soups and I would not recommend it. The chicken Tortilla and clam chowder is way too thick and does not taste as good! I do like the red sangria  The servers are very pleasant and attentive and i did not have to wait for my order very long.  I would definitely come back here but not for the soup. MY Son loves the games that they offer although you have to pay 1.99 and unlimited use until you pay your bill then it will also stop the game :)

Service and food has improved since I wrote the original review.  We have an outstanding service while manager Rene is on duty, but not as good when he is not around.  We love their burgers and fries and hope that they continue to improve.

Been here multiple times and the only thing really worth getting is the tavern double with fries and the onion rings. The 3 gourmet burgers I've tried really had no taste unless you smothered it with bbq sauce.  Today we had Melissa as a waitress and she was super pleasant. Definitely the best customer service we've ever had at this location.

We checked in and we were told that there was going to be a 30 minute estimate wait so we decided to go look at the stores. We got a message saying our approximate wait , so all we needed to do was wait for the message alerting us that our table was ready. 30 minutes passed and we never got a text message so we decided to go back regardless. Once we got there, the lady in the front asked for our name and we told her we never got the text. So she put this face saying "sorry we removed your name because you took to long." We mentioned how we never got a text message so she said "oh well you should've gotten one." Well we didn't, we had to wait a couple more minutes to get seated. We were highly disappointed. Food was great so this gets a three star. Plus good customer service by the waitress.

We have not been to a Red Robin in quite awhile. This one has moved the bar up on what we had expected. Maintains the somewhat garrish Red Robin color combination and the service was good and food was creative - especially the beverage menu for beers and cocktails. We had a nicely done set of burgers (you can create). If you are willing to give corporate restaurants a fair chance, this one is worth it.

We made a reservation for 11 to celebrate my mom's birthday. Our server Sammie made this experience a very pleasant one and everyone in our party was very content with her service. Sammie made sure at all times that we had our drinks filled and was very friendly. The food was great as well. My mom requested her food cooked a little more crisp as she likes and Sammie was very helpful and took the food back without making faces. Very great experience!

The burgers here are just too good to pass up, and you can't go wrong with bottomless fries and their house dip. The Southern Charm Burger is sooo good! My favorite. Close second is the Whiskey River BBQ wrap. They also have a lot of beer and alcohol options. Red Robin Royalty members get a free burger during their birthday month!  Whenever we go, we usually try to ask for Mymy to be our server. She's very attentive and helpful, and honestly makes the experience a lot more easy and fun! All of her recommendations have been delicious!! Really appreciate her customer service.

My boyfriend and I always go here and we always always get the Mudpie for sure!!!! And the Hamburgers are so yummy! The ghost hamburger is the best one and the bottomless fries are the best ones! It's worth it to include the Parmesan cheese! Love going there!

You can get all the fries you want with your burger!! Garlic fries yes!!! This is the place where I fell in love with reds apple ale!! It all started here! And I thank them because it's hard for me to find a great ale beer! This place does get crazy but it's slow on Mondays and Tuesday's.  The food here is good and the staff is nice

On this visit, we were meeting friends from out of town. My friend was visiting family in the South Bay Area and after wanted to see my wife and I for the new year in a casual setting. I have been to other Red Robin's before. The one in La Jolla and the other in Temecula. Both locations were pretty good in food and service. So at first I thought it was a great idea. Good food. Not too expensive. Quick bite to eat.....well, I was right on only one out of three.  The service was real slow. We were visited by different servers at different times but the time between visits were long. We even waited longer for our food. Total time dining was two and half hours. The only reason we stuck around was we haven't seen our friends in a while. They were also leaving San Diego after our meal.  The food was 'meh'. Even waiting for so long and starving. You would think they would serve me dog food and I would say that this was the best food ever. I didn't get that. Just disappointment. I left underwhelmed and no 'Yum'. Never going there again. This Red Robin is a pass.

Red Robin...ummmm? Service was great, but the food was terribly underwhelming.  Stopped here because we were already at teh mall and wanted to squeeze every last minute of that sweet sweet rockstar parking spot that I swooped on this afternoon of Christmas week. It was either RR or Appledeez since we didn't want to deal with the holiday mob scene at the food court. Mi-Mi did a great job with customer service this evening. Food orders were taken quickly (plus delivered accurately), drinks were refilled often, and she checked on us regularly to make sure all was going well. Unless the food is complete disaster, I'm not one to send anything back. I've seen the movie Waiting. "Don't f**k with people that handle your food." -Monty Dinner plates. More misses than hits tonight. I'm glad the apps we shared are available as half orders.  -Chicken wings and chips. A half order is four pieces served over a bed of crunchy, crinkle cut potato chips. The buffalo sauce is mildly spicy with not much lingering heat. The BBQ sauce is sweeter in comparison and neither overly piquant nor smoky. What mostly grossed me out was how undercooked and fatty the birds bits were. I would've preferred a crispier exterior and cooked through for longer. -o' ring shorty. Their mini tower of 5 onion rings. Dat familiar crispy goodness perfectly uniform from the freezer and fried just right to my table. I actually like RR's rings because they are reliable at every location. -bacon cheeseburger. I added a fried egg just because. I'm glad I did because the bacon was thin, fatty and rubbery like it was microwaved. -bottomless fries. Not great this time. Mostly cold and soggy potato planks. Not even their magical seasoned salt could revive them. Other than the onion rings, the food was subpar and the service shined as tonight's saving grace. We don't frequent this location often, but compared to other RR joints, either the quality has diminished and/or the someone needs help in the kitchen. Unless we run out of nearby options we're not going to be rushing back anytime soon.

I decided to come here for my birthday because I'm signed up for the royalty program that comes with a free burger. I ended up sitting at the bar where the server was very polite and fast. He immediately asked if I wanted anything to drink and provided a menu. I ordered a lemonade and a royal red robin burger, (the one with the egg on top). The bartender was quick with refills and was very helpful. The burger itself was very well done and juicy. I chose garlic fries, which were delicious.  I would highly recommend coming here. The food was great and the service was on par.

We had a choice to come here and El Torito and we chose to eat here.  Big mistake. Not only did they forget my garlic fries, but for 99 cents extra, what were supposed to be my garlic fries were pitifully covered in garlic salt and shredded parmesan and heated under a heat lamp. So sad. They also forgot to give me lemon with my fish and chips. Service felt cold as were my fries. Red Robin....YUUUUUUCK.

This Red Robin is alright. I've been here a few times since my aunt likes their food. The food is average to me and the service is sometimes a bit shakey. Once when we came here though there was a hair in my sisters salad. They changed it out and apologized but I kind of thought they would give us a free dessert or maybe a discount since my sis had to wait for a new salad but they didn't offer. Which they don't have to just thought it would be a nice courtesy. During that visit I also tried the garlic fries because I'm an avid fan of garlic fries but they didn't have the taste I was expecting. Guess I thought there would be more of a fresh garlic flavor, but it was more like a garlic powder flavor.  During my most recent visit yesterday although the staff was nice, the service wasn't great. I ordered a burger with onion but they never put the onions in. I had to ask for it. Then I ordered an onion ring appetizer which didnt come. When my entrees came out and still no onion rings I asked the waitress. We didnt get the onion rings til the end of our meal, by then I was actually about to cancel them until they were dropped of to the table. Maybe they regulate the onions back there.

Bottomless drinks and fries, and good service. A little pricey depending on what you get, but good food. I had the about-Cobb-o salad. SOO GOOD! And light too! It filled me up for the rest of the day. Highly recommend!!

We had a keto friendly burger (takeaway) , called fat pig burger or something. The Cole slaw was nice and spicey with mustard seeds. But we had some fierce diarrhea within the next hours after. So I won't get it again any time soon.

The Burning Love burger is by far the best burger I've ever had!!! Red Robin's service, drinks, and food selection give other burger joints a run for their money. Their endless fat fries and fried jalapeño coins always has me coming back for more!

Bee's knees waffle chicken burger was delicious. Garlic fries really good. Wait time was the only thing. Had to wait 22 minutes. And fry portion could be bit more.  Jheeze hook it up with the fries. And don't count on the machine at the edge of the table. Waiter took a minute to serve.  Besides that pretty Dam good.

My family and I ate here this afternoon. The front of the house service was very slow. We knew we were attending during a peak time in the afternoon, but there were only a few sections open (poor planning house manager). The 15 minute wait we were told about became more like 35 minutes.  The food was a disappointment. The burgers were not cooked to our liking, the fries were cold, and everything was overpriced and not as good as we remembered.  My suggestion: have more staff scheduled before 3:00.  We decided we will be going to Five Guys instead next time.

I've been to various Red Robin establishments and thus far no complaints. Atmosphere: this location is right in the mall of plaza bonita. Clean high ceiling restaurants with a full bar and tv's Food: ordered the double tavern cheeseburger comes with bottomless fries. the burger was cooked about a medium rare. it was a good classic burger that wasn't too heavy.  drinks: full bar and various cocktails mixes. ordered freckled lemonade(no alcoholic) unlimited refills.  Service: good friendly service from James the bartender.  Parking: can be hard to find because of the restaurant being next to Crunch gym.  I'd come back for the bottomless fries and freckled lemonade(no alcoholic) and of course their burgers.

Located right next to the fitness center Crunch, and outside of the food court. The longest we've waited for the table was 15minutes, not bad for a busy restaurant on the wkends. Our favorite drink is freckled strawberry lemonade, it comes in a cool looking glass cup. I'll prob get diabetes hahaha...I also love their unlimited french fries, it's always fresh. Yum. My all time favorite burger from Red Robin is their regular cheese burger, buffalo wings & onion rings. Tastes amazing but I always feel guilty after eating them haha.  Service was never a problem for me when I come here. Every waiter & waitresses that served us was all nice.

If you have kids this place is awesome. It's in the mall and I usually don't come to Plaza Bonita but we are having our truck serviced so they offered to drop us off here to wait instead of the dealership.  So happy we decided to pop in here for lunch. Zoey is pretty good in restaurants, but Red robin makes it easy to enjoy and finish a meal without a tummy ache later (you know because you're shoving food down so fast before the kids start screaming).  So hostess was very friendly and made room for the super wide mall stroller we were using right by our table so we wouldn't get it stolen.  and you want Miss Sammy as your server. She is so sweet. First time here and she is just so friendly and the absolute perfect server. Attentive but not too attentive. She had us covered, but we still were able to enjoy our meal. The food. So amazing. Try the chipotle dipping sauce. You will not regret it. I love the bottomless fries even though I absolutely don't need it but yes, I love sharing a few of them with Zoey so that I can order her a cup of fruit with her meal. All in all great experience.  I love how you have the option to pay at the table. The server drops the check, but if you pay with a card you can take care of it right away. No waiting around to get a card back and sign. What they are doing here is very efficient. I love it.  I think every place should be doing that. If they had a charging station I don't think I'd ever leave.

Went today with my girlfriend. Server was really nice, but the food wasn't. Ordered a California chicken and it looked like it came out of Carl's Jr. it was really sloppy and I had to cut it into pieces because everything kept falling out. And the fries? Oh man they were hard as a rock! Probably never coming back.

I went to this Red Robbins with some friends before prom. They said it would take 30min to seat us ,but we were not seated after 30min or 10 min after that like they instructed or ten minutes after the first then minutes. We waited to be seated for 1hr 20min we ended up not eating because thw wait was so much. I was so disapointed and such a special night and we could not be seated
Awesome,  very healthy Menu and friendly people.. food on time , place Super busy and very helpful...

One of the worst experiences I had at this restaurant. My boyfriend and I went for lunch and when we got there we were sat down with menus and told about the appetizers. We didnt get no napkins nor utensils the server didn't care and the manager sat looking around while we waited 20-30 min for our food. When I got my food my bun was as hard as toast and patty was cold. I had to wait on the server to come back and ask for my food cooked fresh. She brought my newer food out but it didn't seem fresh but at the end of our visit she wanted a tip. We will NOT be returning to this restaurant!

I had a great experience at this Red Robin in October 2015.  My guacamole bacon burger was delicious and who can complain with endless fries.  My girlfriend had a salad that she enjoyed and the sauce she had was good with the fries.  The bathrooms were clean and the service was fine.  It was interesting to use the tablet at the table to pay.  I will definitely return.

The Service: Upon walking in we were quickly greeted by the hottest. She was friendly but didn't really make eye contact, I found that a little strange. But she was young so.. So, no worries. She seated us and smiled and that's perfectly fine!  Our waitress, Mayra V (I guess there are two Mayras that work there?) was all smiles and very informative. She taught us how to use the electronic table menu and even helped us join the rewards program. She had quiet a few tables going but we never felt like she wasn't on top of things! She was great about keeping of drinks filled and clearing in wanted dishes. I'll be asking for her every time we come in! The Food: Sometimes I forget how great the food is here!  We ordered the Mushroom Chibata Burger, The Bdg Chibata Burger, the Chicken Nuggets, and the mini pretzels appetizer. Everyone enjoyed their food. I LOVED MY BDG BURGER. It was juicy and so flavorful. I also really enjoy their onion rings.  The Atmosphere: It was the typical Red Robin Restaurant. It was red, cute, and clean. The bathrooms were clean. The only thing I found off putting about my visit there was a gentleman server, at least he might have been. He was clearing dishes and walking in and out of the restaurants kitchen and back room in a black sleeveless tank top. Weird right? Like he might drop some sweat or armpit hair around. It was just off putting.  The overview: Hostess was nice Mayra V was fantastic, had she not been our server I might not be back due to sleeveless guy.  My burger was BOMB Black tank top guy needs to put a shirt on, I don't care how buff your arms are!
Foods great, fast service, consistent, endless steak fries are killer  my kids love it and request it often... if you come here get a damn burger!!!

I have been coming here for years. I have been to several different locations and the food is always great. I always order the fried mushrooms appetizer. The whiskey chicken burger is delicious and the best part is the bottomless fries. The employees and managers are friendly.

Went here for lunch I had the a1 steakhouse burger was delicious nice beef patty good onion roll the veggies were fresh and high quality we also got a mushroom swiss burger it was also very good but maybe too much mushrooms the fries were average service was great the server came by many times I'll definitely go here again.

our first time here. Huge menu, perfect burgers, and the prices aren't all that bad either,drinks were awesome our server(Maira B) was very sweet. Baes dosent always tip just because...he feels you need to earn it. Bbygirl tho got baes tip!! Thank you red robin! We will.definitely come back.

Took my son to Red Robin today. It was busy in the afternoon. The hostess took my name and placed me on a short wait on her iPad. She quits me 10 minutes to wait but texted me in 5 minutes to say out table was ready. The Manager on Duty took us to our table and was very pleasant. Our server was Melissa and she was outstanding. She gave us great service thank you Melissa. Our Royal Burgers were prepared perfectly and the fries were hot.  All in All a great dining experience.  Although all bartenders are amazing - Jazmin Mimi and Tony the food is never correct Waited for hot fries burger with onion which I ordered and my drink which I never got Renee Gm you should be ashamed of yourself I'm over this place

Well then...  After celebrating 70 years of Spartan Pride and Homecoming the class of 78 CVHS decided to swing by the Bonita Red Robin. For burgers and cocktails. We were assigned Sammy.  When we found out she was 2 weeks into employ we thought that serving 10 fired up Spartans with high expectations would break her.... but no! She hung with the big dogs and came out shinning. Only one plate came out incorrect from the kitchen. She smartly gave the choice of keeping the plate but attentively was on the ready to replace... We were well taken care of and.... How happy am I that they had Belching Beaver on tap and 3 menu items at $6.99. I can say it won't take us as long to go back and Sammy is a keeper. Very personable. Our Friday night would have been a 5 star had the kitchen had put the onions on the side and gotten all the orders correct.  Good for you Bonita Plaza Red Robin. Did I mention I went over to the bartender to thank her for having BB peanut butter beer. Yay!!!!

This is the perfect example of how a place can have great food but if they lack in customer service there reviews & ratings will suffer for it. The food here is great, I love the burgers here for the most part there all good I've tried a few, the one with the fried egg is my fav. The fries here are on point & the best part they have bottomless fries here which is awesome. There chips with the chipotle sauce is a very good appetizer as you wait for you're food & trust me you will wait for you're food. The kid options & shakes are good as well. The food always comes fresh & tasting good. Some of the best burgers I've eaten have been here. Yes I love the food here, so why don't I come here more often? Well the service is SLOW & SAD! Every time I've come here the wait is long & never really that busy so I don't get it. And you know what the wait isn't even the real problem here. I don't mind waiting a bit for good food as long as the service is good. Now don't get me wrong the service ain't bad but it ain't good either. Considering that they know the food takes awhile (cuz a lot of people complain about that here) you figure they be more on point.  For example the couple times we are there we had to wait awhile & as we did we finish our drinks & no one would come & check on us ever! We had to flag our waitress down & call them over cuz every-time they walked by us it's like they knew we needed something & they rush by us & not make eye contact with us, they did this with customers as well. We have waited 30 min with no refills & no food & no one asking us if we want more chips or apologies, that's unacceptable! We're not the only ones I've actually seen customers ask to speak to the manger, which I don't do cuz I try not to have tension with my waiter I want to eat peacefully but it's hard not to sometimes. The waitress here are not mean or rude but there not nice or friendly either there just like Blah. Some of them don't even look like they want to be working there, there just there to get a little check & pay there iPhone bill. People like that shouldn't be waitress & working serving people. Look I don't need red carpet attention or a hug when I walk in a restaurant I just want a refill on my drinks & a smile & just check on us & tell us why it's taking long & a apology that's it. I don't even know if it's the waitresses or cooks that's taking long but the manger needs to find out where the problem is cuz it's frustrating (I use to be a manger at a restaurant it's not that hard to find out what the problem is). Retrain or hire some new fast or at least happier workers. Or maybe you guys just need to have an extra 5 min breaks to just hug each other & practice smiling & drink a Red Bull. I don't know but you guys need to do something.  Like I said the food is good & that's why I will continue to come but everytime we decide we'll come here we take a deep breath & say "But damn the service is slow & sad" & sometimes we say oh well & come anyways cuz we love the food but almost everytime we come the service fails us. The food thank god makes up for it but only  enough for 3 stars. This place has potential to get 5 stars if the workers would be happier & a little faster & be more considerate. I wish I can give them more then 3 stars but I can't. Maybe one day I will but till then, come on Red Robin workers cheer up you have a job & we're hungry please be nice & a little faster I'll tip you big I promise.

There seems to always be a wait here and parking is terrible!  I come here a lot with my friend and her kids.  You can make any burger vegetarian by substituting the patty.  I usually try to order a different burger when I go. I love how you can order more fries, unfortunately I can never pack in more than one serving.  Service is variable- sometimes not so good, sometimes okay and sometimes great.  It just depends I suppose on how busy the restaurant staff are.  The milkshakes are yummy but filling, hard to drink that and have a burger.  Overall food is okay and service is random.  Good luck! :)

I was hungry. A hamburger from red robin . Because the last time I was there ibsaid they were so delicious . But this hamburger. We both were delighted with our meals . Although she still wishes she got the sandwich she had . But she wanted to try something new . When got there We got seated pretty quickly . Our meals were both delicious . The service was great .. I highly recommend this place to anyone . You won't be sorry .
The hostess told me that I was going  to wait 10- 15 minutes , after 30 she didn't text me ... Of course I left. Customer service sucks !
Onion rings are the boom !  Was their for lunch today and I always go back and try new things but fish n chips were cooked perfect!!!!  Clam chowder was also a very good!!!! Hats off to cooks

Went here during lunch. It was a little under staffed, but we were seated quickly. Took about 10 minutes to get our drinks. Another 15 to get our food ordered. Some people that came in after us got their food already served, we felt like we weren't getting enough attention although we had flagged down 3 servers to take our order/refills/check. I was pretty disappointed with the service, it's usually decent but for some reason it's been dwindling down. It took a total of 2 hours of time at this restaurant, probably an hour was spent waiting. Red Robin, you either need more staff or better servers.

I visited Red Robin's today for lunch. I walk through the door and instantly got annoyed my sister and I weren't greeted at all just asked us to follow. Now that we're seated our waitress by the name of Rainee comes over she takes our order and leaves next time we seen her was when our cold food came out! I asked for our fries to be replace because they've seemed to have been sitting for quit a bit. Long story short.........her customer service was the worst I probably would never eat here again. I asked for well done burger and it came out pink

I've never been to Red Robin and I probably would never go again if it wasn't for Rene the manager. My guest and I sat and asked 3 different servers 3 different times for a fork because my guest ordered a salad. I'm in the hospitality business and I understand things are forgotten and get busy, but this was ridiculous. Honestly if it weren't for Rene the manager, I'd give 1 star. He fixed the problem with an apology and a brief discussion and I was very satisfied with his demeanor and professionalism. Kudos to Red Robin for hiring people like Rene and putting them in managerial positions.  bc

Went here yesterday, had a great time, good food, and excellent service.  All the things on the menu look delicious, and everything we had to eat and drink was fantastic. Definitely worth the drive to Chula Vista. Server was very patient and helpful.

This is my first visit to Red Robin. To tell you the truth, I've seen the TV commercials but didn't know we had one in Chula Vista. Too bad, I wish I would have known - I enjoyed this lunch.  Server was very friendly (Jane), she gave us the heads up on the Red Robin Royalty card. Very Cool. They give food and discounts away.  There was a little wait between the time we ordered and the food arrived at table, not too long. Food was good & filling. I had the Red's Taverns Burger & onion rings - yum! Onion rings crispy just like I like them. Mom had the Smoke & Pepper Burger, it smelled great and would have taken a bite, but mom would have given me the stink eye! Lol.  The Root Beer Float a Drinkable Dessert! Bottomless Barq's and soft serve kept looking at me but I kept my composure and just had iced tea. Pretty quiet for a lunch crowd.  I'll come back & check out dinner, then watch out Root Beer Float. I'm coming for you!

Went here last night for dinner. I had the BLTA croissant. It was good. Service was good. We asked for more fries & they gave us a brand new batch. Every time we come here, food has been the same. My daughter had the grilled cheese & hubby had a chili burger. We will be back if we are in the area.

Great friends, great evening.   Highlight:  We ran out of fries and out of no where Miguel is at our table with hot and fresh fries.  He wasn't even our server.  Great service Miguel! Lowlight:  The side caesar salad.  Why bring the entire head of romaine lettuce?  On the tiniest of plates?  Dressing drizzled on top?  No silverware?  I get artistic, so it had eye appeal, but we wanted to eat it!  It was ackward, and unappealing.  Salads should be preassembled.

Went there on an hour lunch with several co-workers. Sat and ordered quickly at the empty bar. 30 minute wait for burgers and fries! No warning. No time to eat so we had to box it and go. So much for the bottomless fries. I'll never do that again.:(

What keeps me coming back here? Honestly, I love burgers and fries. My favorite burger is the Royal Red.  Order the onion rings, they're fantastic! The waiters are usually in need of an attitude adjustment. This one particular hostess is tops and super friendly.

The service at this location is good. They usually have a wait but it's worth it. The servers are nice and attentive most of the time. It's a little pricy but the food is delicious. The burgers are always well done and delicious. The appetizers are pricy for the quantity but delicious and the drinks are good too. They have Tv's and if you seat at the bar or around the bar you can enjoy the games.

I ordered the Red Robin Gourmet burger with a fried egg. It was very delicious!  What was even better than the food today though was the service we got. I called ahead and showed up earlier than I expected and our table was ready. We were seated immediately. Our server Maricela was by far the best server I've ever had. She asked for our drink order and kept them coming before we even needed to ask for refills. She was amazing. I'll definitely be coming back to this location.

I only come here because my wife and kids like it here but man...if it wasn't for the beer and the wings , yes the wings....I wouldn't come here. The game is on and the beer is cold...good enough for me but a "one star" for Red Robbin!

I used to work here and I'm disappointed with the service and the food.  The patties were half the size they were supposed to be. Whether it's an economic move or what, not sure. They don't have garlic butter fries anymore. Our waitress brought out drinks AFTER food was served and even after did not check up on us.  Save your money and go somewhere else. Red Robin used to be one of my favorite places, but has lost it's luster and charm in all areas of food service. Not going back here for a long time.

If I could give this particular branch 0 stars, I would for zero concept of customer service, management, and organization. Been here twice now and on the first visit, our server had only talked to us twice--1st time was to check on our order and second was to give us our check. We got our entrees waaay before our appetizer, which came while we were halfway through our dinner. Second and even worse time, they quoted us 20-25mins for a table but actually got seated close to an hour later. And if that wasn't bad enough, it took 10 minutes (yes, we timed it after the horrendous wait time for the table) before a server actually paid any attention to us. And then, par for the course, said server went to check on us only twice yet again, just like the server on our first visit! She seemed more than happy to attend to the other tables except the two on our side. Thank God they've got those Ziosks on every table now, otherwise I shudder to think how long it's going to take them to give us our check and how long to get our card back. I got a very stale, spiritless mojito and my husband barely got any strawberries in his freckled strawberry lemonade, even in the refills! Needless to say, we are NEVER going to give this particular Red Robin another chance!

Went  with a friend to check out the restaurant and try the food Atmosphere: combination of  modern twist meets commercial grade technology. plenty of open space  and not too crowded Parking: ample room Prices: fair and reasonable Food: hot , on time quality gourmet burgers Fries are served in tin cups .... WHY? but could  ask for unlimited refills overall great expereince with nice server

I can't believe that so many people go to this particular restaurant. The red robin in UTC is farther away, but it is far superior in every single aspect. This one in Bonita is just terrible.  My wife has some strict dietary requirements that only a few big chains cover, and thankfully red robin meets these requirements. Unfortunately, we live close to this location. We don't have too many options for dining out, and if my wife wants a night out at a restaurant that doesn't require a 45 minute drive, this is the only option:( The service is routinely slow.  Don't trust the people up front when they tell you how long the wait will be; tonight we were told 20 minutes and waited just over an hour. The food just doesn't taste as good as any other red robin, it just is bland. Also, if you order a gluten free bun, expect it to be stale, that way you won't be disappointed when it comes. They won't let you sit outside; ever. I don't know why they even bother with tables out there.  Tables sit unbused for long periods of time while the pile of people waiting u the door grows larger.  Right now I'm counting three tables with dirty dishes and 10 people waiting by the door. It just feels like the management at this location is consciously understaffing to save money.  The waiters, in my experience, don't seem particularly happy or interested in human interaction.  This place sucks.

Went to eat lunch, the hostess was friendly and had menus ready as soon as we stepped inside. Our waitress was very friendly and polite. She had another guy shadowing her, and he too was very polite. They gave us recommendations and chatted as we tried to make up our mind about what to order. Both checked on us made sure were okay and if we needed anything. They both provided some of the BEST customer service we've received in a long time. Our food came out promptly, and it was very good. We ordered burgers, they were medium well done and delicious. I'd recommend to come in as soon as they open so you don't have to wait long.

I came in the other night with my boyfriend for dinner and after I sat down, our server named Alia greeted us... Then asked us if we wanted something to drink. I asked for a Dr. Pepper &' when I got my drink it was by accident a Rootbeer and I asked another server for a Dr. Pepper she came by and politely apologized. Then got me a refill and said "I promise it's Dr. Pepper." So as a joke I told her "oh this is Rootbeer!" She looked surprised and said "no way i swear it was Dr Pepper." I just loved how easily she was able to get along with and her personality was so energetic. She's an awesome server !

This Red Robin is close to home so we normally stop by for a burger. Last night we stopped by to take advantage of the free burger for veterans and active duty military personnel and to say the least it was SUPER BUSY. I won't fault them for it because providing free meals for military is very generous. Our server Marcella did a great job even though she was swamped. We both ordered the tavern double and two of the Not Your Father's Root Beer Floats and they were AMAZING! I was skeptical at first but that first sip changed my mind. The beer itself is 5.9% or something like that but they give you the rest of the bottle so you can refill it. My only complaint is that it's not bottomless! The burgers were good of course and fries were filling but the real winner for me is still the Jalapeño Coins in the pick 2 App deal. They aren't CRAZY spicy and just a little salty. The mozzarella sticks are good too. We are always full and happy when we leave here and that's what we go for. Also, they have these awesome little machines at the tables now where you can order desert, apps and drinks from and can also pay your bill so no waiting for your check. Overall they get a five stars from me. Keep doing you RR.

This location is nice inside, the food is good, and the hostesses are nice, but I think the waitstaff is lacking.   Personally I felt the appetizers were small for the price. The waiter we had on our most recent visit was polite but very hard to get ahold of, he just wasn't around much. I also think this location does not give large enough baskets of fries. We always end up needing to order a second basket right when we get our first basket in order to prevent time with no fries.  I think this location could be improved with: -smaller sections for waiters/waitresses to help customers get more attention. -larger servings of the bottomless fries to please the customers and lower the amount of times the waitstaff has to tend to the customers.
Great experience our waiter was so polite and always checking up on us very helpful I think his name was Deeon definitely coming back!

Crap service. Waited for a table for almost an hour and the employees kept saying it would only take 5 min. Service is slow and many people are kept waiting for just water. Very disappointed never coming back.
Great service!  We had a small party of 4.5 and had to wait 30 minutes on a weekday night not too long of a wait.  Food was good and I was able to order something healthy so I was happy!

If I could give zero stars I would but This was by far the worst restaurant experience we've ever had. First we were told it would be a 20-25 minute wait for a party of 2, understandable it was a Friday and it seemed pretty busy. They asked us for a phone number and told us they would text when our table was ready. There were no seats inside so we just sat outside to wait. 30 minutes go by still no seat, 45 minutes still no seat, an hour goes by still no seat so I go in to check how much longer the wait is. I ask the hostess she looks through the list and she says that it doesn't look like my name is on the list. She said that her manager reset the list and that we weren't the first ones to come up saying the didn't get sat. She then went to get her manager but when she came back she said that they didn't want to come up and that she's sorry that it's gonna be another 15 minutes. As I'm walking out of the door the manager came out and then asked me what happen then sat us after a few minutes. He took our drink order, we got a freckled lemonade and a raspberry limeade. Our actual waitress brought out our drinks then took our food order and we ordered the Nacho.m.g for an appetizer, I got the buzz Mac n cheese burger cooked medium well , and my girlfriend got the a1 burger cooked well done. So the nachos come out first and a different girl brought out our food. By this time I was done with my first drink and I set the empty glass at the edge of the table. The nachos had barely any cheese at all and the little cheese it did have was all in the middle and was microwaved too long. Shortly after the nachos came the same girl that brought out our nachos brought out our burgers. My girlfriend takes a bite out of her burger and it was the complete opposite of well done and mine, when asked for medium well, was extra well done. For me it wasn't a big deal I still could eat mine but for hers it was unacceptable so we press the call server button on the table. We wait about 10-15 minutes again for her to just come up to our table. Now again she didn't bring out our food just took our order and this is 10-15 minutes after we've already started eating and this server never once came to check on us or ask if our food is tasting okay. We ask if she can bring it back to make it well done she takes it and they make a whole new burger. Now by the time we get a new burger my girlfriend has already finished her drink and she drinks extremely slow. When they bring out the new burger a new person brings it out, sets it on the table and walks away without saying anything. This burger was cooked fine so we continue to eat but, still have no refills on drinks, no water and also no napkins. Now I could probably wave my hand and ask for a refill but I feel I shouldn't have to especially if my server has ignored us literally the entire time and she even walked past our table multiple times and looked over at our table. So it's getting close to the end and my girlfriend wanted to take the rest of her food home. So we hit the call server button again and this time we wait another 10 minutes for her to come to the table so we ask for a box. We watch our server go back and fourth with a table next to us and also receive boxes and refills. Another 10-15 minutes go by and by this point I got the attention of the guy that sat us in the beginning and let him know what else had happen. It only took him a couple minutes to get us a box and he also gave us a 25 dollar gift card because I had already paid while waiting for the box and we just wanted to leave. I've served for many years in the past and this girl should definitely find a new job. We won't ever be coming back to this location for red robin. It was our first and last.

I was pretty disappointed in this establishment. The service was extremely slow and our waitress although very nice was very young and lacked the professional demeanor and knowledge that I've come to expect at any restaurant. I love eating out and love trying new places and am usually able to give second chances if the first time was not satisfactory. But the food tasted like a dried out McDonald's meal. And to have to wait 20 minutes for a drink and then another 20 minutes for fries is just ridiculous. Me and my family went on a Monday night and the place was not busy and there was an abundance of waiters and waitresses as well as the Manager standing around. Will not be going back to this location.

I asked for a medium burger and the burger was clearly white in the middle and pink everywhere else, but browned on the outside. Obviously, when there's white in the middle means it was kept frozen and takes out all the flavoring in the meat, so it's clearly not fresh. I just complained to the waitress that it wasn't cooked right and they offered to make me something else (but we all know how the restaurant business is)... Anyways, we ordered an appetizer and that never came. The service and food here sucks. Never coming back.

If I could back up words that were written by my own hand and retract the way I feel about a place, it would be about this restaurant. Red Robin is like a fine woman when you noticed that things are better the second time around  This time around for me the hamburgers at red Robin are the best. They are full of flavor and very delicious, french fries are just like I like them, fat and meaty. I've never enjoyed a hamburger as much as I did here. I can't wait to go back again. The service was a little slow but efficient and they really do take care of you. I love you RedRobin.

Service and atmosphere are solid.  Its a fun environment.   The fries are very good for steak fries.  Some are nice and crispy and some are softer.  I like the extra seasoning that they put on it. The stack of onion rings is fun to eat.  The rings are yummy with a right combo of onion to batter, and its nice and crispy.  The only thing is that they're obviously the frozen variety because they're so perfect.  They're definitely good, but there are a lot of places in SD that have more of a handmade touch. The basic cheeseburger is just ok.  Its more like a whopper because it seems like the condiments overtake the patty.  The meat doesnt have a flame grill or char character to it. The bbq chicken salad was very tasty with lots of texture.  I'd probably only come back here for the fries, and to try something other than a burger.

A group of my friends and I decided to have dinner together at around 6:30 pm but it was pretty packed tonight and there was a 30 minute wait. Considering how busy it was, service was, of course, delayed but still decent. The wait time to receive our food and get refills on our drinks wasn't as bad as it could've been. I ordered the Freckled Lemonade and the Royal Red Robin burger with garlic herb fries and decided to try the bacon aioli. I really liked the Freckled Lemonade and it's definitely one of my favorite drinks there (the twisted cup it comes in is really cute). As for the burger, the patty was cooked fine but the egg was slightly underdone. Adding a little of the bacon aioli helped boost the flavor but it was just alright. It's about what you'd expect from a chain restaurant. My friends and I agreed that the food was fine and it's an okay place to meet up to eat and catch up but nothing to write home about.

Mediocre food that has dipped below what I remembered them to be. Went here expecting to have an awesome burger with bottomless fries. Instead I got a really sucky burger and bottoms less fries of one variety. They used to let you change the option as long as you paid the up charge. Our waiter seemed more interested in closing as soon as the hours hit for closing then to ask us for things and water before we asked. Hope you liked your $2 tip. Stick to In n Out. That's it.

This place has been around forever. I love burgers just as the next guy but I have to say I don't know why I waited so long to try them out. Not only are the burgers good (as any burger should be) but what makes this particular burger place different is that it's also satisfying. I don't get full on a single burger and like most guys, we consume a lot to get full (from my experience) but upon my second visit I have to admit.I'm FULL! I don't recommend the house margaritas, go for the adult version - they are tasty. Thumps up.
Server attentive,  Food was hot and fresh. New oniin ciabatta bun was killer. Get the sweet potato fries and 1,000 island dressing. You'll thank me.

This place is pretty good if you're into burgers. They don't try to go too far away from burgers. But they're pretty good. Bottomless fries are hard to argue and they have good seasoned fries for just a little extra. But still Bottomless. Like less than 50 cents. Service is good. Food comes pretty quickly. Overall a pretty good experience. And now they have the tablets at the table so you can order and pay with minimal confrontation.

Ok, so a Red Robin is a Red Robin--I won't comment on the overall experience of eating at this chain restaurant. It is what it is. Just a couple of things about this particular location: First, for the gluten-free folks, every time I order a burger on the gluten-free bun here, it's SUPER stale. I have not had that experience at other RR locations so I don't know what the problem is here. Maybe they're storing them in the freezer too long. Second, it's always hot in there. Either they don't have air conditioning or it can't keep up. The waitstaff have always been nice, but eating a hockey puck while sweating is no fun. Update: if you do go like we just did (I never learn, apparently) avoid sitting in the bar area. The male bartender/waiter who is there at lunch time on weekends didn't write down our order and was multitasking while half-listening to our orders today. Sure enough, both of our meals were wrong--my husband's burger cooked wrong (he ate it anyway) and my burger on a bun when I ordered it in the lettuce wrap due my dietary restrictions. No apology or even glimmer of acknowledgement after I had to wait for them to make mine over again.

When I hear bottomless... I'm there! Next time I hear bottomless and it has Red Robin in there somewhere... I'll probably pass. Not sure if it's this particular location, but they are slooooow. Our waitress took forever to take our order so when she finally came, we were able to put our food and drink order in together. One of the people in my party ordered a salad but since the waitress didn't like coming to our table, she decided to bring the salad with her burger instead. I ordered the Double Tavern Burger thing and it was a Burger King burger for sure. Just three times the price. I would say that the plus is the bottomless fries, but she decided she didn't want to bring any until we asked. Keep in mind we have a party of four and there are about seven fries on each of our plates. Three of the four had hot fries in their basket and I had semi-stale and very cold fries in mine. Luckily the ONE basket of fries she ever brought was hot so I was able to eat those. Our drinks were also never refilled and we finished them before the food was out.  I guess she had customers in the kitchen since she was hanging out in there the whole time. I'm assuming her tips are not what paid for her fake breasts. Sorry I had to go there.

Had to try something different and our server "Sam" suggested the Southern Charm burger.... It was delicious and full of flavor. Service was good and Sam was on point. Never had to wait more than 1 minute for anything requested. Tonight dinner was a home run .....

Let me start off by saying I really like the food at this place or I should say I use to. So we ended up going last night to grab a burger. We sat down and waited and waited for waitress. The poor girl seemed to have tables all over the place. While we are waiting we look around and the restaurant which was kind of dirty. Tables were left unclean all over the place. It Should have been a sign.  We order the buzz wings as an appetizer to share. Two burgers and drinks. Wings were burned and didn't not taste very good. We had to ask for ranch to help them get some taste. Very disappointed. Burgers were so dry and the buns were too toasts they were burned. We did not finish the burgers. Fries were not great either. Our dinner was a flop. Stay away from this red robin and maybe try another one. Hire more staff and train your cooks better.

I was kind of excited to go here for a burger because "Gourmet Burgers" was in the title.. The good: The burger was ok. It wasn't the best and wasn't the worst...Would I return here for this specific burger? No. Would I give it another shot and try something else? Maybe.  The steak fries were good and were served steaming hot so you know they're fresh.  I love the idea behind all the sauce choices however, charging .75 for each one is kinda nickle and diming.... The bathroom was not clean and there was trash/debris all over the floor of the main part of the restaurant. The service was average as well.  I was not impressed.

Food quality has changed throughout the years. Presentation is poor, service is slow and lacking of flavor.  The decor has changed too. They used to have sports memorabilia all over the walls of this 2 floor restaurant and now it's completely bare with dark gray and deep colored walls. The wooden blinds are being held by tape. Yes... I said tape! Atmosphere wise, I just wanted to hurry up and get out of there. It's still busy because it is attached to Plaza Bonita mall and unless you want to eat Subway or Panda express from the mall food court, this is one of the few options. Our waitress Jasmyne was very nice and attentive.  I give her 5 stars but not Red Robin. If you want to eat at a sit-down restaurant and rest your arm from swiping your credit cards, go to Chili's instead.

Health Dept Warning. I was fed a severely undercooked Marco Pollo sandwich. as in the center of the breast was completely raw. I've called corporate. and Will be calling the heath dept. about this. THIS IS UNACCEPTABLE PEOPLE

If you get a waiter named Jose Luis, do not expect great service.   We went on a Wednesday night and oh man was our waiter slow. At times we had to ask more than once for a specific thing. I had to ask twice for my first refill of fries and by he time he got them my burger had gone stone cold.  Not only that but he got my order wrong to begin with. Refilling drinks seemed to be a foreign concept to the man and just getting our check ready took 15 minutes.  Also, as part of my photo , I got the supposedly spicy ghost pepper option on my burger and the effects were less satisfying than if I had just used some Tabasco.  Less than amazing service and tasteless food earns a 1 star. I don't often give those out but this was just a terrible experience.

AWFUL! !!THIS PLACE NEEDS TO BE SHUT DOWN...We ordered  3 burgers & asked for well done ,Wich our waitress did not make a note of on her ticket.They all came out way undercooked & one of them literally had drops of blood...The tables were So sticky we had to wipe down ourselves. ..We left without eating ,but still payed the bill because of drinks & one kids meal.We dont have much money & havnt been out in months & to get this type of service was heartbreaking to say the least....WARNING DO NOT GO TO THIS LOCATION! !!!!

Doesn't matter if I'm eating in or dinning out, this RB is always friendly!! Great customer service and quick service! Greatly appreciated!! Shoutout to James and Mimi for having great customer service and for being amazing friendly!!

Every Sunday my family and I eat out for lunch but it's a struggle to find a place that is good and accommodates a large party. Today we ate at Red Robin. Rene the manager was so nice and helpful when I called ahead to let me know we were coming. Upon arrival I asked if it would be okay to add 1 more person to the party and yes with a smile. We were seated as soon as everyone arrived. The food was great, our server was nice, quick and efficient. Can't wait to come back!

We arrived at around 5:30 ish on a Friday evening and asked for a table of 5.  Started off well, we were sat in about 10 min....but then it went downhill.  2 ordered booze shakes, one got hers and one had to ask 4 times for hers to come long after her food came over an hour.  One of us got the wrong food.  When the runner came out with the food she spoke so quiet we couldn't here her and she had no idea of who got what food.  We had to ask for more napkins twice, waited over 10 min to get a knife to cut our burger.  Several of our drinks were empty for over 20 min with no one checking back on us to see if things were good did we need anything.  We asked for 1 refill of fries and that took forever as well.  When 2 of us asked for dessert the waitress stood on the opposite side of the table and made me repeat myself several times vs just walking over to my side of the table.  Plus our waitress kept telling us "you could have ordered that through the tablet machine on the table"  Did she not want to work...if i have to order my food on my own then why should i tip her?  One of our party went to the rest room and the toilet was not secured properly in the handicap stall and almost fell over.  When we kept asking about the missing shake we kept being told by 4 different people "oh lets see if it is at the bar"...then they never returned.  One of us spoke to the manager who said he would be over and after 15 min more of waiting we finally just paid our bill and got the heck out of there.  We will never eat here again.  No one there valued us enough to check back in on us and not long after we got our food we got our checks like they wanted us out.  Never had such poor service and it was sad that this was the end to our wonderful day we had spent out with friends.

Probably the most annoying experience I've ever had. 1. We ordered our drinks - Blue Moon and Stella  2. Took about 15 - 20 mins after ordering our drinks to have our food order taken 3. Our drinks finally came 4. The Blue moon was flat and the color of orange juice. The most annoying part was that the bartender should have caught this and should not have served it 5. We sent back the blue moon 6. 15-20 mins later we finally get a new blue moon and it was a lot better than the first 7. 10 mins later Our food comes - not sure if it was because we were hungry, but it was probably the best part of our visit 8. We get the check 9. They charged us for two blue moons instead of one 10. Took us about 10-15 minutes to flag down a waitress to fix the mistake All in all, service here is very slow.. Not sure if they were just short staffed that night or JUST SLOW.
Food is good. Garlic fries are super yummy. The manager there was an idiot and kept trying to tell my mom her order was right when it clearly wasn't. So three stars.

The service was good and the atmosphere was actually pretty cool. The food is usually really good but this time around the bacon was kind of hard. The rest of the hamburgers we had were actually amazing. I would more than likely go back.

the food is good. the burger that i got was seriously melt in your mouth. i put 4 star because i think the server forgot about us and took forever to bring our food. she did apologize for taking long. she mentioned someone took my order on accident. but overall she was great very friendly.

My friend and I came here for lunch last week. Hadn't been to RR in a long time, and I forgot how great their burgers were. But I'm writing this review because of this location's outstanding customer service. The wrong order was put in for my meal- no big deal right? I didn't even complain, but the staff immediately informed me my meal would be on the house and they had the right order out within less than ten mins. I was in shock, but grateful for their hospitality. We actually were given a new server when this happened- I hope he knows we weren't upset. Mistakes happen and it's only food. But thank you to the staff for going above and beyond both with comping my meal and from everyone from hostesses to servers being genuinely friendly. Will definitely be returning in the future. :)

I have been to other Red Robin restaurants in the past and this place did not disappoint! I walked in, walked over to the bar, placed my take out order, and within a short amount of time, the food was ready.  When I got home, it was still warm and my wife and I had a nice dinner.  It seemed as if they skimped a little on the french fries on my take out order so I had to take off one star for that. Thanks Red Robin for the December birthday burger and for the quick service!  We will be back.

If you're looking for a great burger, you should instead go to Eureka, which is about 50 yards away from Red Robin in the same outdoor mall. Eureka has much better quality burgers for the same (or slightly cheaper) prices. Also, Eureka has much more tasteful and mature atmosphere. Red Robin would probably be better for a family with kids.  They won't cook any burgers less than medium at Red Robin, which is unfortunate, because I prefer medium rare.  The atmosphere at Red Robin is very casual and playful. It's probably great for families with kids. They have iPads (or equivalent tablets) at each table for paying the bill and playing games during your meal. I find the iPads fairly distracting, but depending on the type of group you're with, the iPads could be fun.  I haven't tried them, but Red Robin definitely has some substantial milk shakes and root beer floats.  If I remember correctly, there's a bar inside.

Fantastic service! Our food came before we were even done with our appetizer, that's four stars right there. Ordered red tavern burger, its a nice little double cheeseburger very good. Bf had guac bacon burger, he devoured it.  Portions are a bit small, at least for the couple we ordered, but so good and filling! Bottomless root beer float, can't believe it. Still can't believe it.

I usually like Red Robin but this time, not so much. Took my niece here Friday around 5pm and the wait to sit down wasn't long. We were immidately greeted upon arriving and was told it'd be about a 10 minute wait which was closer to about 5 or so minutes. Nice! From start to finish it was a waiting game inbetween our drinks, the appetizer and then the wait for our food to arrive was starting to increase which was making us hungrier and crankier by the minute! Finally, we got our food and lets just say, after you make a grilled cheese and let it sit out, the cheese starts to look rubbery after awhile... yeah, that's what her food looked like. Here's a break down of what we got: Grilled Cheese (just make one at home yourself), Mac & Cheese (which was apparently yummy), a side of mandarins and a side of brocolli (which she liked as well). I got the Blue Ribbon burger which was okay and garlic fries (save yourself the .99 and DONT GET IT!.. there was SOO much salt it was unbearable! I only ate half of one fry). The food was only warm and didn't appear to be fresh out the kitchen which was unfortunate.  Finally, my waitress followed up with my request for my nieces birthday and provided her with an ice cream sundae and a happy birthday song which was great. Overall, the wait time for the food just wasn't worth it. Consider dining elsewhere if you're REALLY hungry.

Definitely came thru when needed!! Diana and her crew got us in out when we were going to see a movie!! Great food and great service!! The ONLY place to go before seeing a movie!! Love the "bottomless fries"...

I am a trollop when it comes to patty melts, and I was happy to see they had one on the menu here for $8.99 which came with all you can eat steak fries! ( )   I had them make the melt medium and they gave the cooking temp justice. The melt was very good. The beef patty was flavorful and juicy. ( ) The sauteed onions were succulent and tender. I like that they served the Thousand Island on the side, so that I could control the amount I put on my patty melt. The marbled rye was perfectly grilled and had a great crunch with a nice rye flavor. Great patty melt to say the least. The steak fries were good, but my first serving came lukewarm. My second serving came steaming hot straight out of the fryer. They had a crunchy exterior and soft flavorful center. They were much better than my first serving. ( ) The service was great. It was a little intrusive when I first arrived, but I politely told them that I had not even had a chance to check out the menu. After that, everything went smoothly and was on point. My refreshing iced tea was refilled several times, ( ) and I was asked how my meals was and if I needed anything else. Good service. Go Patty Melts!

Firstly, the food was super delicious but the service does not compare in any way. We had asked the lady if she could seat us at a table and not a booth, we waited and she quickly came for us to say there was a table available. She sits us at a booth but it was a honest mistake and promptly found a table for us which was kind. Now, the waiter (forgot his name) was friendly at the beginning and brought out drinks in a speedy time. My father ordered an iced tea and we noticed that there were no sweeteners there. We asked our waiter if he could bring some and he was fine with it, however, he was taking a while, so we asked a busser if he could give us some from the table he was cleaning. The busser was really sweet and gave them to us, we even mentioned they hadn't given us napkins nor tupperware and he was surprised. Our waiter was extremely forgetful. He actually never even brought the sweeteners we asked for, nor none of the lemon wedges we asked for with our drinks, and only brought the napkins and tupperware with our dinner (after we had already eaten our onion rings). Our food took a little longer to be brought but that was understandable due to the fact that it was so busy! My only issue with my plate was that he didn't add the avocado to my burger as I had requested but he changed it quickly and I don't think it was too major. The food was great and I always love their burgers. All in all, I would come back for the food and not the service.

Came here a few days ago with my sister & mom & I ordered a Guacamole Bacon Burger, it was delicious ! I ate that thang in one whole bite (: Their garlic fries are good too AND bottomless which makes it even better ! I think the best thing I had was the Salted Caramel Milkshake, it was PERFECT ! I'm a big fan of Milkshakes & this was probably the best I've had (: Service was good too, our waitress was really nice & she checked up on our table consistently. Definitely coming back soon !

I opted to go to Red Robin and brought home a Red Tavern burger with fries and also the prime rib sandwich with au jus.  The burger I had upgraded from the tavern patties to the single regular (thought it was gonna be a double?)but honestly I couldn't tell the difference. It was a decent burger but I couldn't imagine paying this when there are better burgers for a lesser price closeby. The prime rib sandwich was good but definitely disappointing in size. Definitely not lacking in flavor though.

This location in particular has very bad service and all the employees that work there are all on there phones looking at there FB rather then helping the customers and the Manager is very indifferent when you explain that you have been waiting for over an hour and nobody is helping you , the manager gave an attitude and told me they where busy and there where no tables available but on the place whas almost empty and plenty of tables , went about his business and never got helped!
This place is gross, the tap water tasted disgusting. The seafood scatter was horrible. Never coming back here.
Top notch burgers. Prepared just the way you like them. The Onion rings are some of the best around.

It's a red robin....and their food is consistent with any other red robin that you would go to; but their service isn't up to par (at least for a work night). Walked in with a friend of mine, plenty of open booths, some still needed to be cleaned but otherwise open...and instead of asking us where we would like to sit or even sit us where anyone would want to sit (a padded booth) we're sat at the high tables next to the bar...as are the next two groups of people, crammed together. If you lean back just a bit you run the risk of hitting the person behind you. At the time I was too hungry to care or bother to say anything about the seating. Our drink order was taken and returned quickly, as was our food, but the waiter didn't come to check up on us for the rest of the meal....and thanks to our drinks being mostly ice, they went empty pretty quickly (we each got a soda and water). He must have passed our table at least a dozen times, never once asked us if we wanted anything else to drink.... I get it when restaurants get busy you have a smaller chance of being noticed by the wait staff, but they weren't busy....and there isn't an open soda/water fountain where I can re-fill my own cup.  As customer it's frustrating and annoying when you're paying a few bucks extra for the sit-down experience and are promptly ignored.  After looking around the restaurant it seemed odd, tables weren't being cleaned off in a timely manner (one of the tables that had dishes on it was still dirty when we left) and the staff seemed overwhelmed by the few people that were there. Bottom line: food was good, but if you just want a burger and fries, go to In-n-out, or any other red robin, because you shouldn't spend the extra time and money in a sit down restaurant that is filled with unobservant and unhelpful staff. Literally the first time I've given no tip....but in my defense, it was earned.

Okay, well i just want to say that i as actually a big red robin fan!  Do I still like it here yes, this particular location.. ehh I don't think so. Alright so ill keep this short, waitress comes (nice gal) i say no pickles on my chicken sandwich, minutes later food shows up EXTRA pickles! like damnnnn, my sandwich was mega soaked! So it takes me a while to chase her down, i tell her she apologizes, picks up my food and tells me she will be back, 15 mins later, she comes back, my sandwich was nice and fresh, Yay no pickles, but the new fries she comes back with has a HAIR!! REALLY? yes really!  My boyfriend and I just ask for the checks, she apologizes once again, and tries bringing a manager over but we didn't want the hassle so we payed and left, and i was still hungry.
Went to eat early so the place was pretty empty, which is a good thing. Food came out fast and was pretty good. Waitress was very polite.

2 years in a row I've come to this Red Robin for Veterans Day and the service is so awesome! The general manager Rene is very personable and interactive with customers. As a former service member, I appreciate the love and support they have for our military. :)

Good burger joint. Many options expecially for those who eat clean. The atmosphere is good and the facilities are clean. The decor is rad and kids could have fun. Happy hour is ok and the beer selection could be better. Overall I would come back.

Worst fcking service. Waited for 20mins just to get our order taken. Another 20mins to get our food which was just clucks & fries. They can't even get the fries right. I asked for garlic Parmesan but I got regular ones. I told them it was wrong. They came back with the same regular fries. Like really?! Then when they came back for the THIRD time they pretty much dipped the fries in garlic seasoning. I was so pissed already for waiting & you can't even get one small order right?! & they asked if they can try to get the fries right again. I declined & told them I don't want spit on my next one. NEGATIVE 5 stars.

Went to dinner at the Plaza Bonita Red Robin with my family to celebrate after the 49ers game. Was seated promptly and everything seemed fine until our server introduced himself... - consistently had to ask for refills - had to get up and go to bar to ask for refill after asking for one - very unattentive - walked by us at least a dozen times without asking how our food was or if we needed anything (which we did) - never asked if we wanted more fries (they're bottomless...C'MON...we really have to ask???) - even the manager walked by and looked at our empty fries baskets and empty sodas and didnt do anything I understand that places get busy and at times it gets hard to accomodate your customers but it was very dead at this location and time. I have been to the UTC Red Robin several times and I have never had to ask for a refill on anything and I felt like a priority. Maybe the UTC location should be the training center. Buh-Bye

I would have given more stars of it wasn't for the manager.  My boyfriend and I went in for lunch and were looking forward to using our royalty card to get out free item. My boyfriend had to change his order because his first one didn't qualify as the free item. Only to find out that we can't get the free burger because my card wasn't registered, even though I went on line and registered the card the night we got it. If there was a problem with my card, one of the other associates should have told me one of the other 9 times we were there. The manager came up with 101 reasons as to why we could not get the free burger. He was just very unfriendly and not willing to help one bit. Not only that but the food wasn't that good this time around.

Love this location. The food is always delicious and we have our favorite waiter Jose Luis. He is the most hardworking Person in that place. He makes our experience so much better. So friendly, hardworking, and always has a great attitude! The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because twice we got our food before our appetizers but it wasn't a big deal because the food just came out fast.

I used to love this place but it sucks now. The burgers are pretty low quality considering how much you pay for them ($9-$14). The burger I had (banzai burger) honestly tasted like a Burger King whopper with canned pineapples. Not too pleasant. They do not, however, lack in customer service. They're pretty quick

Definitely my wife and my go to date night spot when we want burgers. We each have our favorite burgers and drinks. Every time we go, the servers are super attentive in refilling drinks and fries. Food gets brought out much quicker than most places and the staff are very friendly. Is it lunch yet?

I recently came in to celebrate my birthday here and need I say that I loved every minute of it. I have never been to a red robin before and the experience that I recieved was well worth the anticipation.  The food... was amazing!!! My favorite item of the night was the tower of onion rings with campfire mayo!!! So bomb. Service.... My server was so kind and so attentive to my big group of 10. She really went the extra mile in making sure that I had the best experience ever. She really worked out the itty bitty things for us like more refills more fries extra sauces and seperate checks. If I'm correct her name was melissa. :)))  Will definitely come back for more onion rings and great service. Thanks red robin for making my birthday a memorable one to remember.

This place is really nice inside. I loved the bonzai burgers. And the onion ring is one of the best one I tried. I must say I didnt like the waiter at all.he didnt give us napkins or utensil. And didnt come back at all. Overall the food was pretty good.
Horrible service and my plate and silverware where dirty!! The only good thing was the beer!!

Today the service was more on the bad end. We were 2 and the wait was supposedly 10 minutes... it turned into about 15 but eeeeh it was cool.. I know how that works. We sat and the server came quickly and took our order. The food took almost 20 minutes to arrive and in those 20 minutes never once did the server pass by to see if we needed anything or to bring us at least fries with our meals.. and we were STARVING!!!!  Once the food finally arrived, My burger tasted funny and the fries were cold! uggggggh... ok, I was hungry so I kept eating... I was looking for the server for a while to get some new fries, but did she ever pass by? NO. I think she was new because she seemed rather lost as she was standing around by the kitchen line (I could see her from my table)... she finally walked on to the dining room and I had to flag her down. Throughout our whole dining experience, she never said "thank you" or "hello" or even "how's everything?"... when she passed by to get her tip, not even then did she say "thank you" or at least "have a nice day"... she just took it and left.  Definitely not the best service I've had at this location.

Made a custom burger and it was amazing!' Maricela gave amazing service and was very fun and patient. It was very busy on a Saturday night and she didn't forget about us once! Keep up the great work maricela and kudos to the cooks too!'

UGGHHH! What's really sad is that generally normally the service is on point & so is the food BUT tonight everything was just OFF!! I came w/ my two teenage kids at about 4pm & it wasnt busy at all. The server was nice but only checked on us one time. We didn't get to enjoy the bottomless drinks because as I said previously the server only checked on us ONCE!! I ordered the riblets & mac n cheese...the riblets were over cooked & the mac n cheese was cold in the middle...now we all know that if sumthns cold in the middles its because it was previously made & frozen until it needed to be served...thats a no no for me. I ordered a salted caramel shake my FAVORITE but it wasn't tonight because tonight it came out in this rinky dink little water cup!!! Wha da heo!?! It usually comes out in a shake class w/ the extra onv the side!!! At the end of service I was given the check that didn't have our right orders on it & I could've just paid for the one person meal I was charged for but I was honest & asked for my hefty size check for the 3 of us lol the only good thing I can say is the prices really are reasonable but other than that boo on you Plaza Bonita Red Robin boooooo!

Simply divine! I have had the pleasure of eating at an Red Robin many years ago out of state and it was a great experience. The food is delightful. I suggest getting the onion ring stand, at least that's what I call it. You can either get 6 or 12 nice size onion rings on a rack. Great for ring lovers. If you love burgers then you will love all the many selections they have. I say each time you visit try a new burger. The only thing I had to check them on was the milk shake was ordered to go. They didn't fill it up to the top. And if you know milk shakes you know it's filled to the top not 3/4's that's a milk shake sin... However, they were nice enough to take and fill it up. That's good customer service. Thanks "Tamara" our server.
Excellent service and food is good...great for kids! The servers keep the drinks coming and who doesn't love bottomless fries!!
Jane was absolutely the waitress. When was friendly and she was very kind to our kids. The burgers were very good.

1st: my husband and I only returned to this location because we were given a $20 from management because of the last visit we had which was over a year ago. 1year ago: met husband for quick lunch. Ordered 2 burgers and 2 drinks. Order came 50 minutes later!!!! Husband left after 40 min because his lunch break ended. He didn't even get to eat a fry! I just about walked out but I flagged our server down-who was so busy chit chatting she didn't notice our sense of urgency, and I told her to just have them box it up. Honestly, I don't know why I didnt just cancel the order and pay for the stupid drinks...I was trying to be nice. Server apologized and explained that they had very little kitchen help and that was why they were so slow. She went out of her way to ask management to comp our meal. I thought it was just a bad experience and didn't want to write them off. Present: it was not that busy in the restaurant at 9p but it took forever to get our drink order in.
