We had to ask for utensils from our server. Both of us got the wrong buns for our burgers and it took over 30 minutes to get our food.  The tables and menus were sticky. Will not go back EVER. Go to El Toritos or Applebee's.  Quick service and it is cleaner! This place is a dump-employees, service, cleanliness. Come on! There are too many other competitors out there! Get it together!

Used to love this place. Lots of new rules and charging extra for everything, as well as plates 1/3 the portion they used to be. Don't need to come back. Got a salad and it had a breast of chicken which was great, but only had like 3 beans and kernels of corn. And the plates used to overflow with lettuce and toppings and I thought they served us the wrong plate it was so small. Service? What waitress? Manager came to help us.

This place has really good food and drinks, but the service is lacking. I normally wouldn't post this if it was a one time thing, but there is some sort of a 'problem ' evert time we come here. Hardly any chili on the burger, people seated after us being served before is, and once the server never even put our order in! You have nice people working here, but there is some sort of a disconnect somewhere. The staff is always apologetic and tries to compensate, but as a customer, it's getting old that we have to say something everytime. There are a lot of other places to go eat and we don't come here as often as we used to. And that's a shame.

These guys take customer satisfaction to a new level! They've highly exceeded my expectations with their promptness and effectiveness. They took my review seriously and promised to work on the issues with that branch. Hats-off to Red Robin management team. Note: I took it up from 2-star to 4-star just because of management responsiveness, and NOT because the branch issues were solved. Still think UTC branch highly excels over Bonita branch.

Just another burger and french fries joint showcasing American cuisine. I felt that the atmosphere here (in terms of the interior decor) reminded of the 1950s. After all, this business started during that timeframe. I want to note that service here is great. I even saw the manager come to each table to make sure everything was all right. Good business practice! As for the food, I was really excited to try the Red Robin Gourmet Cheeseburger. One, it registered as the "Holy Grail" burger in the burger hierarchy. Two, it was the seminal product in determining any future visits. The burger seemed like any other burger, see photos. I suppose the true distinguishing mark is the brand's way of making the product. In addition, I found the steak fries very soft and golden. It tastes so good when dipped into barbecue sauce. To conclude, I would say that the atmosphere is welcoming, service is good, but the food is not anything to be jumping unicorns and rainbows about.

Our waitress sucked. She messed up my chilli cheese fries twice. ALL I WANTED WAS FOR THEM TO LEAVE OFF THE BACON. I understand it's hard for Bacon eaters to grasp the concept that not everyone eats Bacon, but I don't eat pork period. We only went to red robins because my husband had never ate there. Food was basic. Wont return to this location, because mall restaurants always suck. What was I thinking?

I've been here a few times and every time we have received horrible service! Today we were seated quickly but we sat here for 20 mins before anyone came to great U.S. Or take our drink order.... Then when we finally saw our waitress she took our orders and we didn't see her again. The manager was making his rounds and asked us if we wanted more chips for our appetizer that had come to the table 20 mins prior and I said no because now it cold. He did offer us another but at this point I'm already irritated. I would be a little more forgiving if they were slammed but they weren't at all. I mean there were only 10 tables with people! Anyway... I was not impressed. I probably won't be going back since this isn't the first time this has happened. They need better staff and better managers!

They were great. The hostess Isa was friendly and helpful. Food was good. I took a star off because I asked for ciabatta bread and they gave me a sesame bun. They offered to change it but I refused. Why waste food? They were busy early too.

I'm giving 5 stars because the food was good and the bartender Lisa was awesome!  I felt good walking into the establishment, everyone greeted me with a smile and a good afternoon.  I can honestly not take anything for this chain restaurant.  I love it and again the bartender Lisa was awesome!!!
Was given a gift card for this place haven't been here in a while. Service was good the girl who was my server was really nice decent burgers decent price unlimited fries .

Worst hostess service ever. Wait time was 30min, then another 15min, then another 15min, 1hr 30min for sit down. Inside the eating area was half empty and people who arrived after me were sent down before me. I was given a table for 4 when we were a party for 5. Don't recommend

We have been to this location several times. And never have I encountered such rude and terrible service. So bad that we left. We signed in yesterday around 6:45pm they told us the wait would be 20-30 mins for 2 adults and a baby, and yes we asked for a high chair since we weren't allowed to bring our stroller in. Both girls at the front were rude several times. They did keep apologizing about the wait but not until we had been waiting 45 mins did they decide to tell us they had a party of 25 and Thats why the wait was so long. That and the fact that they couldn't find a table for a high chair. What place doesn't accommodate havin a child with them?? My husband and I felt very frustrated and to be honest the girls up front made us feel as if having our baby with us was our fault and the reason for the long wait. Manager was nowhere around. We left upset, hungry and with a cranky baby. We could have had her in her stroller that whole time we were waiting. But no, we couldn't bring the stroller in with us. Very appalled by the terrible service, not being seated, terribly long wait, and the extreme rudeness of the employees here. We have always loved this restaurant but we will not be going back and will be telling all of our family and friends about this. And we will be Sharing this post with the public as well. Very disappointed.

Not my preferred burger joint, but I'll go if someone wants me to go and/or is craving Red Robin and/or if I'm feeling too lazy to suggest to this person the better local burger joints. Atmosphere and service was decent. Got my refills promptly. They do what they're known for pretty well - namely their steak bottomless fries and their freckled lemonade. Both are quite addicting and before you know it you'll have finished either/or or both before you finished your burger. I'm not a ketchup person so the fries can be a bit plain without them - try them with the signature seasoning salt. The lemonade is very sweet and the strawberries are sweet enough to munch on as a dessert. For some reason I ended up getting fish & chips. My brother made fun of me as I got FISH AND CHIPS at a BURGER JOINT. I think I'll stick to burgers, as I have gotten much bigger and much better quality fish & chips for about the same price at pubs, even with the vinegar and tartar sauce. The gooey chocolate brownie cake is anything but gooey - Chilis does it better. The cake was quite dry. Also don't see how it can be any better with strawberries. Supposedly they have a St. Patricks Day shake - Guinness, Jameson and chocolate ice cream. Now I know how to make Irish Car Bomb shakes! Sweet!

Melissa was our sever for lunch today and was an absolute delight! She was super friendly and on top of everything. She brought our food out in the expected time, didn't rush us, and made our experience a very positive one. Thank you!

Been here a good number of times.  Environment: Cool theme, has a bunch of 70's posters covering the walls. I never seen a TV installed in the floor before, I thought that was cool. Also has a few more TVs around the place. Bathroom is nice and clean.  Service: Never had a problem with these guys. Very patient with you, kind, and friendly. My recent  visit had a very cute hostess, white girl, cute face, thin and a very cute perky butt. Sorry didn't get a name and I hate to be a part of restraining order. Ha!  Food: These are food that I have had  *Clam Strips and Chips: 3/5 Like their steak fries. Not fantastic just addicting. Clams are lightly battered and seasoned so you can still taste the clams original flavor, which I like.  *Towering Onion Rings: 4/5 always a must get with me. Onions don't have that strong white onion taste, batter is seasoned and crunchy. Comes with excellent dipping sauce. Campfire and Ranch sauce.  *Red Robin Gourmet Cheese Burger: 4/5 I knew on my first visit that I should try what they are known for so I figured why not their original.  *Banzai Burger: 3/5 The idea of putting a slice of pineapple in a burger was kinda weird for me but was OK overall.  *Clam Digger's Clam Chowder: 3/5 it's OK. I've had better at BJ's Brew house but still good.  *Rookie Magic: 4/5 Hershey Chocolate syrup with Oreo cookies mixed in with vanilla, makes you want to bath in it because it's soo good.  You can see why these guys have been in business since 1969. Continuing great service and excellent food from it's original establishment in Seattle. Thank you Red Robin Board of Directors for opening up a store near my hood.

Decent service, great tasting food and too expensive.  Who do they think they are serving astronomical prices for a burger?  Almost had me skipping on over to Johnny Rockets before they closed down.  We Ordered: Bleu Wave burger with bottomless fat-asss fries Cobb Salad Both were extremely delicious that it felt like the X-Games in my mouth.  Just so much flavor and fat! The bleu burger had bleu cheese obviously with crispy thin fried & battered onions along with the standard veggies and condiments on it.  The flavor just hit the spot for me... I was looking for a mama to slap IT WAS THAT good, but instead the new years resolution-ers that just came out of the gym next door decided to pick this place to blow their diet and say, "I'll start my diet again tomorrow." ... so in short no slapping took place.  The cobb salad was big, protein worthy, delicious and expensive.   Service was fine, nothing special, nothing spectacular.  She had me debating on giving her a 10% or the standard 15%... She never refilled my glass of soda and you gotta be damn sure that if you're paying $3 for a soda she better get her ass over to my table and refill it as many times as I want to get my $3 worth! ... but she didn't.  I ended up giving her the 10%.  Sorry Lady, but you blew it!  Can't do your job I can't calculate 15%.

been here a few times to make use of the bottomless fries! sweet potato of course. that wasn't the issue tonight. waiter asked how i want my burger done, i say medium rare. what do i get? a dry, beyond well done, crispy, ruined slice of ground beef I've ever had. I've always ordered mine medium rare and it would always come medium at times, which is fine. but tonight, that pretty much ruined my dinner. char broiled? more like char burnt.

I loved this place! The only bad thing is that one, if you go on a saturday then you have to wait for like 30-40 minutes to get seated. Second, the drinks are pretty expensive. So if you want to go there and eat this place is perfect. But if you want to drink then you should better go to a bar. I had their patron margarita and it was OH SO GOOD!

Not to sound like a beezy, but whenever I step into a restaurant, I always expect service to be good ( no service, no tip and that's my rule ). I'm pretty blunt. I've only been to This restaurant twice, and twice I told myself " sure why not give this place another try"..but I knew in the back of my head if you don't like it the first time, you probably won't like it the second time. Came here on a Monday night with my boyfriend and we were seated in the corner of the restaurant close to where the exit was. At first I didn't mind, but my boyfriend kept on mentioning how freezing it was because people would be exiting and coming in through the exit every 5 minutes or so. I also noticed that we were seated far away from everybody else as well and this made the servers less likely to come to our area.  We ordered a salted caramel milkshake which tasted extremely salty so we had to get the attention of a waitress and asked to get it remade with less salt. When our food finally arrived ( with a different waitress before ) we asked about our salted caramel milkshake and she looked confused, when I overheard her talking with the bartender that made our drink, he said " no they didn't want it, they said it tasted too salty ." The waitress came back and apologized telling us she would remake it. When it was remade and finally set on our table, we took a sip and it turned out to be a vanilla milkshake. No hint of caramel whatsoever. We asked to take it off our bill and the waitress looked a bit upset. She ignored us the whole night except for refilling our fries and when we were finished we waited almost half an hour just getting our bill. I don't think there will be a third time visiting...ever.

Went there last night, waited for 5 minutes for a table which was not a big deal. We quickly placed our order of drinks and appitizer with our server. We ordered the 14 piece of wings with buzz sauce, when the food arrived we quickly noticed our 14 wings were only 10 and that took 20 minutes for those to come out. Advised our server who quickly got it resolved. He was VERY FRIENDLY, even though he spoke quickly and softly. we then placed our food order which was 4 burgers meals, with no special request to change or add to the meal. Very simply order with an almost empty resturant at this time. We wait, and wait about 45 min passed before I got the manager. Advised the manager of the long time, he was very apologetic, and gave us a little discount. Just reading the review now I thought they were just under staffed. Guess they just have horrible service. Will not return to this location.

If I can give this place ZERO stars I would. When we first got there we waited maybe 10 mins. That was the only good thing. Then the real waiting began. Our server took our drink orders quick as our food order. I ordered a basic magarita. Never again. It was watered down, not tastful at all. So I just asked for a coke. Can't mess that up. So we wait and wait and wait. We waited 40-45 mins! Why we waited I dont know. Our server passed us so many times with no acknowledgment what so ever. I was very disappointed in this place. The food was not even good, or hot for that matter. The service was horrible, as the food. We will never go back to this location again. Spare your time and go elsewhere.

This is the first time I have ever reviewed any business.  However the service and food was beyond terrible that I felt compelled to make my first review.  The hostess has to be one of the worst i have ever seen.  there were maybe 4 tables occupied and when I come in she leaves to the kitchen comes back a few minute latter to seat us.  Doesn't offer a greeting or even say hi and obviously looks like she hates her job and can careless about the customers coming in.  When we were eating it was impossible to get the waitress over to refill the drinks.  We saw her when we ordered then didn't see her again till we got our food.  If I didn't literally go to the kitchen and walk up to her we would of never have received service.  When the food came the toast that came with the clam chowder was burnt black and the burger was so cold the cheese didn't even melt.  I asked for another piece of toast since the first was not edible and  the waitress looked at me as if nothing was wrong with it.  All thing considered it is rare to go into a restaurant and receive both terrible service and food but they accomplished it very well.  Definitely lost me as a customer.

I would have liked this much more if I wouldn't have frequented a topnotch Red Robin for years prior to trying this one in Bonita. Reasons to go: 1) Menu.  Burgers are unique & tasty! 2) Bottomless fries.  The home-style fries are pretty good with the Red Robin seasoning. 3) Location. It is on the outside of the mall and a great option while shopping. Reasons to avoid: 1) Value.  At this particular location, the service and quality of food simply doesn't match the prices that are paid. 2) Location.  You can pay under the amount of Red Robin and get better quality food next door at the Mexican restaurant. 3) Service.  I have a few pet peeves that abrasively irk my soul: bad drivers, people who don't pick up their dog's p00p (especially if I have to clean it off my shoe) & not getting the check paid for when I am ready to leave a stinkin' food establishment.  These guys hit hard enough on the third that I am not going back.  Too many other options with El Torito next door and the food court inside.

Excellent service!  I would give this location four stars if they hadn't burnt my hamburger.  I think medium well=burnt.  Should have got it medium, it would have been well done, but at least not burnt. They have tasty drinks.  I tried the cherry lime flip and it was really good.   We had spinach artichoke dip that was really good, but the portions were small.

the food was good...as usual...it came pretty quickly..my lemonade was good but my boyfriends absolut freckled lemonade didn't taste like it had any liquor. They remade it and the manager brought it n apologized very good customer service in my eyes....would have been a 5 if we didn't have to ask for silverware n a better drink

Banzai Burger (marinated in terryaki sauce with grilled pinnapple) ADD bacon, SUBSTITUTE regular fries for garlic parmisean, side of ranch dressing and a Freckled Lemonade (strawberry lemonade) to drink, please.   Waiter's response:  "Of course!"

"Where should we eat?" -I ask   "I don't know...where do you wanna eat?"--BF replies "Well, I don't know. What do you feel like eating?-I say This lasts for about 10 minutes and we never seem to know where to eat. Finally, as we were sitting in our cars parked in front of the mall, we decided we wanted some endless fries. So, it was Red Robin we come!  It was our first time at this location. Everything was new, bright and huge! The entrance glass doors were gigantic and there was a TV in the floor. Yes, I said "in the floor." I guess it's to keep the kids busy while you wait. It's a super kid friendly place as there's huge animal characters and balloons throughout.  Like my friend who reviewed below, we also got Cher B. She was totally nice and helpful. Right now, apparently Red Robin is having a box special. On each side of the box there's a special. My bf got the Prime Chophouse Burger (fat burger, shoestring fries, mushroom and cheese) and I got the Southwest Grilled Chicken Salad. Both were only $5.99! And did I forget to mention that my bf's burger came with a side of ENDLESS FRIES!? *Be sure to sprinkle some of that special seasoning on it! Next time we're debating where to eat, Red Robin just might save the day!

Super busy and still got great service. We were told there would be a 15 minute wait, but since there was only 2 of us we sat in the open seating in the bar. Our waitress was working her tail off and still greeted us right away and kept our drinks filled.  Thank you, Lisa! The menu is huge, a lot to choose from. Our burgers were delicious. I liked the free extra sauces for the fries. We will definitely be back. The only downside is the parking at the busy mall.

First time ever at red robin. We went to plaza Bonita. Service was a mess the food was worst. I ordered soup n wrap. The chicken wrap was ok but the onion soup sucked. It was bland the bread was disgusting. I switch it to the tortilla soup. It was good but the fact that there was a hair in my soup did not jive with me! The last of our appetizer chicken tenders was not cooked thru and it took for ever to get refills. Not a good first impression:/ oh my son. Got sick from the spaghetti he ordered. So my husband n family decided to give red ribbon one more shot we went to UTC about three weeks later. Guess what everything was great. We told are waitress our story that we are giving it one last try. Everything was great. The manager at UTC came by an asked how everthing was. That was nice. Bonita never again

This is quite simply the easiest review I've ever wrote, this place is simply disgusting. Came with three of my friends. First of all out server was never around, secondly they didn't give us napkins, and third of all the food was horrible. 2 of my friends burgers were completely burned and my chicken sandwich was raw in the middle. I'm talking about pink, like I could have gotten good poisoning from this. Definitely would not recommend this to anyone unless you're in the mood to end up in the toilet 30 min later.

Came in on a Friday night with the family. Was seated within 10-15 minutes. Jose was our waiter and took good care of us. We were ten minutes early for their late night happy hour. He took my drink order and put it in right at the start of happy hour. Ordered the Burnin' Love burger. Nice and spicy. We've been to Red Robin a few times already and it's nothing better than any other joint. Wrote this review to recognize Jose who was excellent. Checked in on us frequently and have prompt refills on drinks and fries. Average burger restaurant prices but great happy hour prices after 8pm. Stop by after 8pm Monday-Friday if you want a cheap cold beer and a good burger with unlimited fries.
"Red tavern burger" sucked ass!!! It tasted like a whopper from BK. Our server, jennifer was awesome.

The service is incredibly slow. It took about 10 minutes for my party of 4 to get our drinks. They don't even have napkins on the tables and when we asked for some they gave us only one for each. The burgers were unremarkable despite their high price and they came with about 6 fries. I've had better burgers at fast food places. The root beer floats might be bottomless but you'll rarely get more than 2 refills since they take forever to get the refill.

For the last 3 weeks, been there once every week. I love their food. It's basically a burger joint. However, there's so much variety. Oh, they have big ol' bottomless steak fries with their special seasoning (you can find their seasonong on any table you sit at). If you're not in a mood for a burger, they have chicken sandwiches, soups, not a big variety of wraps though, However they have a decent amount of appetizers - great for group events.  Overall, I'm there for their great customer service. My server was fantastic (Jody), she was on top of things. Everytime, I've been there I have requested her since.  Although, it gets busy Fridays thru Sundays. It's worth being patient. If the food is good, the wait is worth it. That's how I feel when I go to Red Robin.  Beware this is a kid-friendly place, so there will be a lot crying. I love children, so I'm able to put up with them and very patient. You can ask additional stuff such as extra veggies, condiments, etc. People who are have allergies or who do not want to consume gluten or/and vegetarians they have several options for them. One last thing, they have this Royality card. If you sign up, you get a free appetizer which expires 2 weeks once you activate it. You're eligible for a daily drawing to win daily prizes. You get promotional items in your email as well as after your 9th purchase, you get a free entree, appetizer or dessert. Absolutely love the idea.
Prime rib dip w/ garlic parmasean cheese fries = YUM! Don't forget about the bottomless fries.

I came here today for the free Jim Beam Burger Special. If you first name is James, JIm, or Jimbo you get a free Jim Beam burger. I ordered some fries and some freckled lemonade with it. I ate at the bar and the bartender asked if I wanted the hamburger red in the middle. I said to make it as red as they would allow. I asked them to hold the cheese on the burger. After what seemed like 20 minutes the burger came and as I suspected it came with cheese. The bartender saw it and said you ordered it without cheese didn't you? I nodded and waited for the next rendition. The next burger came back after another 10 minutes and it seemed a lot smaller and also was cooked well done. Well what the heck it was free! It was a decent burger with the bourbon sauce and onions and bacon on it but it would have been a lot better medium rare. The freckled lemonade is a very good deal at 3.99 Total bill came out to 6.50 so not bad.

Enjoy their speckle lemonade, endless fries, and burgers.  The salted caramel shake is a glass full of joy. Staff service has always been consistent. The atmosphere has all the accommodations of a sports bar minus the sports bar attitude.

One of my comfort food spots in the Southbay. I love coming into Red Robin when I don't feel like cooking or have been out and about on the weekends. Its also a cool spot to watch a game while the wife is shopping. The staff there is friendly, professional and the food is good.

The food is gross and the service is slow. I had a burger, can't recall the name of it but it's was runny. Way too much sauce on it which made the bread mushy from the time it arrived at the table. Falling apart and no flavor. Waitress wasn't friendly and payed little attention to our table.

I used to come here all the time.  So last night was our first time back in 3 years.  Burgers are still on point.  Our waitress "Melissa" was very nice & efficient!  I ordered the Bleu Ribbon burger with the Garden patty instead of the beef  with a side salad.  It was delicious!! Can't wait to come back!

This place is good. Big burgers with bottomless steak fries. Service is ok. I guess it depends on the time and day if you're going to get good service or not. But most of the time it seems like you're forgotten and need to flag someone down for refills, napkins, straws, sauces... Well, the food is good and at least the bathroom seems to always be clean.

If I'm starving and have no idea where or what I want to eat, Red Robin is the first place that pops in my mind.  Endless fries?? For reals!!  They have THE BEST turkey burger patty here along with a variety of other yummy favorites like their fish & chips!!  It's cod, too!  I like that you can make your own burger at a reasonable price and not have to pay $15 for a gourmet burger when you can get a delicious one made here.  I also love their mud pie.  Red Robin, you rock!!!  EXCELLENT SERVICE BY TAMMY by the way, every dining company need more servers like her, she's ON IT and deserves a raise!  WE LOVE HER!  Keep it up Red Robin, because you have lots of customers that keep coming back your way!  Awesome and affordable, I like that!

I used to go to the Red Robin in UTC all the time. When this one opened up a short drive from my house I was really excited...then I got over it.  I hadn't been to Red Robin in a couple of years already, the burgers sure are delicious, and the fries are even better. I have never quite figured out why they don't offer a buffalo chicken sandwich, I have even written a letter. The fries are are the best thing there, although I got like 7 more fries when I asked for my refill.  The service is always way friendly, the drinks are always refilled quickly. Parking at the mall sucks but thats what you get at Plaza Bonita.

Me and my friends are all rewards members and have ate here several times. 90% of the time the service is horrible! Bottomless anything is no good when you can't get the server to come to your table long enough to ask for a refill. We have gotten hair in our food! The wrong orders! And one waitress in an extremely low cut shirt who refused to make eye contact with the females at the table but had no problem sticking her ladies in the males face! Get a job at hooters!! There is one all star on the team however, James he's a bartender who served our table once and was amazing! He's the only reason we go back!! He's the best! Make sure u ask for him!! (He is the other 10% from the beginning of my review)

I looooooooooooooooove this place!!! This is the only location that I have ever been to and all three times I have been there, the service was great!  The hostess sat us fairly quickly and our waitress was super nice. The last time I went my waiter wasn't too friendly, but he was very quiet and not all that much attentitive as my past waiters. But for the most part they are all friendly and take care of their customers. I have had something different each visit and every meal I got was delicious. I love their unlimited fries!!! Their GARLIC PARMESEAN cheese is AMAZING!!! I love it w/ ranch and those are my fave!!! Buut my last burger was so good i wanted to lick the paper it was wrapped in!!! I got a PUB BURGER and it was so good w/ double cheese and sauteed mushrooms & onions... simple and the bun it was on was bomb too!! LOL I recommend alot of ranch and bbq so for fries and dipping for your  burger!!  REEEEEEEEED ROBIN... YUUUUUUUUUUUUMMMM!!!

Ate here a while back and tried their cheeseburger. It came with a basket of fries...however, I was a bit underwhelmed with the amount of fries that came with the burger in the basket. Although the fries were cut up in what seemed like wedges I'm used to having at least a decent amount of fries come with my burger. The burger itself was decent. It was cooked medium to my request and I especially liked how fresh the onions were. I saw that they have a decent happy hour which I may have to try out sometime in the future. The inside of the restaurant was very clean and had a cozy atmosphere to it. The service was good and I was tended to very nicely. I am interested in perhaps trying out their other burgers sometime too. First choice? Naw. Return trip? Maybe.

If you're craving a filling meal of burgers, fries and shakes and you're in Plaza Bonita, Red Robbin is a nice place to eat in. You pay a decent price for service, bottomless fries, a place with TV's visible anywhere you look (even on the waiting room floor), and a place to catch up with people ya like.  Their Mint Brownie shake is great too :]

Loooove love love their Freckled Lemonade.  ...and that's pretty much it. Everything else is pretty standard burger-joint/American restaurant fare. Service was great-- our server was nice and made sure everything was fine before she gave us our space to devour our burgers. The restaurant is roomy, the seating is comfortable, and there's even a second level for parties and such. The food was pretty standard, nothing I'd write home about. Their bottomless fries can be "upgraded" for the garlic version that is...sprinkled with garlic. But do try out their Freckled Lemonade! Refills are free.

Very nice place to have lunch/dinner. My Bf and I always come here when we feel like eating out. This is definitely first on our list. We love burgers but they do have a lot of other different sandwiches, soups and salads! Tried almost every burger and loved every single one of them. Parking is kind of hard during the weeknights/weekends since it's a part of Plaza Bonita, but it's worth it. They have good food, fast service, great decor (but kind of random at the same time) and did I mention the bottomless fries AND freckled-lemonade....  Love this place!

I wouldn't even give this place a star if i didnt have to. Ive visited this location frequently and they made 3 errors out of all those times I went there with my family. But make sure you never complain about your order if they mess it up because they will somehow make it your fault. For example me and my family visited the restaurant last night and they made a mistake on 1 out of 4 burgers. I asked for a 3rd patty on top of 2 burgers and onl one burger had the extra patty. when I brought it to the attention of the manager Anna on duty she pretty much said that were lying that she counted the patties on each burger herself? then she said that pretty much even though were lying that shell remake the burger. That doesnt do the whole situation justice after being embarrassed in front of others that were eating in the restaurant. Not only was she wrong she was embarrassing as well. This restaurant has the most mess ups out of any place Ive ever eaten!!! Not only will they tell you your wrong if you make a complaint they will call mall security on you as well

I don't know if they were just short on people or they just plain suck at serving people. Seriously!!! So here's the deal. Me, my wife, and my youngest go in at like 7:40pm on a Thursday night. Happy hour starts in another 20 minutes. Life is good. Well, my wife really wants to try a grasshopper and asks if they can make one for her. If I remember correctly the server went to go see and returned stating that they have a full bar so they can pretty much make anything. Hey, it is Red Robin right. Well, I decide I'll hold off on my drink order so I can take advantage of the $2.50 drafts in like another 15 minutes or so, so I just ask for water.  Several minutes later, like way too long later, the server returns with two waters and states that they can't make a grasshopper for whatever reason. And by the way, the grasshopper only has two different kinds of liquors and milk or cream. And they really should have those two liquors in stock. Seriously pathetic that they can't make it and that we had to wait soooo long to find this out. In fact, the people next to us, who arrived after us, leaned over to ask us if we waited foreve to be served. Maybe they were wondering if they were being discriminated based on their race. No!!! The service just sucks here.  Moving right along. 8:00pm comes and no food. That's fine as I go and get my beer. The bartender here had no personality and was constantly leaving the bar to do this and that. She couldn't care less about me and that fact that I was looking at her as she took off to the kitchen and whatever else every time I went to the bar for another drink. Three drinks in total. Oh, and the $2.50 drafts during happy hour are only for the crappy beers. Two in total I think. So anything good, forget about. Almost $4.00 for happy hour beers with flavor like Fat Tire and Newcastle. Geez, I can go to Wing Stop on H street in Bonita and get Fat Tire for only $1 all day Wednesday. And I have. And I wrote a review. And you can and should read it. And I was buzzed, thank you very much. So a funny thing happened during all this. While we were sitting there forever, another server came over to greet us and get our drink order. She was in the area the entire time. I mean, did you not see us sitting there forever? If so, wouldn't the first thing out of your mouth be an apology for the wait? Of course we told her we had been helped and she moved on.  So on to the food. I got the whiskey burger thing and fries. All quite good, and especially good with a nice cold Newcastle. My wife ordered the Clucks & Shrimp. Wow it was pathetic. I can't remember how she liked it, but we just looked at those pathetic little shrimps like, "what the heck?" I picked it up for a closer look as the server came by and she asked if she could help or something. We just told her it wasn't what was expected and she apologized.  My daughter got the kids burger meal, which she gobbled down the burger quite well. The only thing is, we asked for a lemonade and never got it. Luckily we had some apple juice for her.  So anyways, the server never came to our table after giving us our food. Not once for refills for my wife's drink or to see if I wanted more fries, which I did. I was really hungry. When we got the bill I told the server we never got the lemonade that was to come with my daughters meal. She apologized and offered it at that moment to go. We declined. She really should have discounted the meal. Right? So I left a small tip, and it should have been smaller. I just feel uncomfortable leaving nothing.  I want to say it is the managers fault or they were short on staff or something. I just didn't see that things were so busy or so crazy in there to explain the level of service we got. It sucked. It sucked bad. Two stars only because the burgers were still good and maybe this was a rare occurrence, but we seriously won't be going back to find out.
Fun, low key restaurant in the Plaza Bonita mall.  The waitstaff is great.  I ordered the chicken Ensenada, which was pretty good.  I also sampled my sisters hot wings, which were pretty tasty.

Had a Gift Card for My Birthday.....Can you say yum?  Our waitress was great and the food was great minus one thing....Somehow an extremely sad odd looking black fry ended up in my husbands burger. Must have been a sweet potato fry because it was small. Waitress was kind and quickly got the manager who laughed with us and took my husbands burger off the check. Both were kind and very pleasant.  LOVE the Very Berry Limeade...Will Be Coming Back Like Always...Maybe the 3rd time Will Be The Winner!? lol

The nice thing is that I will probably never crave Red Robin again. The food was ok, the service was ok, but nothing really stood out to me. Typical chain resto, typical menu, typical service. I really wanted the peach drink thingy that they had years ago.  They don't have it anymore.

Red Robbin is pretty good. But I didn't like the fact we can't start with fries anymore. That's one of the big things their known for and now we can't start with them. Other then that, the food was good.

I love Red Robin Burgers and salads (hello, whiskey river burger).  When I worked at UTC, I loved having lunch at the Red Robin there and drinking as many strawberry lemonades I could to make my $5.00 worth it.   Unfortunately, the service at the Plaza Bonita Red Robin has turned me off to going.  As always, the food is good, but the past few times I've been (both on busy days and dead days), the service has been terribly slow.  And the past few times I've ordered a salad!  Recently, I've ordered the chicken salad and my boyfriend has ordered the prime rib dip.  Both times, they were ridiculously slow and his prime rib dip even came out cold.  I'm pretty sure it doesn't take that long to make a salad.  I also filled out the survey to complain about the slow service in hopes it could be improved and was told I would get a call back (investigating why I was displeased with my service) and did not receive a call.   I guess it makes sense though, when you have that big of a chain restaurant, a few complaints don't matter.  After all, location is everything.  I'll still be returning because it's the closest whiskey river burger, but I probably would pass it up to go anywhere else if I wasn't craving something specifically from there.

The food was good and it was a nice bonus that they serve unlimited french fries with your burger. Burger I had "Burnin' love" was delicious and way spicy - how I like it. Server was very nice and polite, though he didn't come around enough to offer iced tea refills or check to see that I was ready to pay the bill (I always place the credit card/check at the edge of my table in plain view). Towards the end of my visit, the manager (I think) came around more frequently and thanked me several times for my visit on the way out. Would like to try some of their other menu items - I liked the landscape of the restaurant and the vibe, though a HUGE family with lots of kids settled in next to me as I was finishing up, so I'm glad I was nearly finished eating -geez, I'm starting to sound like a cranky old man.

I've been here three times and I must say that the people are very nice! It's very clean and I love staring at the art on the walls of the restaurant.  Basically their chili burger is amazing along with their other burgers All I can say is bottomless steak fries and bottomless drinks!
Good burgers and fries! Fries are unlimited and the seasoning is delicious! I remember going to a red robin back in high school with a bunch of friends and eating 20 baskets of fries! lol...

I'm only yelping about this location in particular... not the others I've been to. I believe this is SD county's newest Red Robin location. It's NICE!!! Plenty of seating. I especially like the upstairs seating. Makes the place look huge. The bar is off to the side so others (especially children) won't see you getting wasted! The service was efficient. I can't remember her name but our server was quick and pleasant. Honestly, I wasn't paying much attention to her since I was there with one of my old homegirls from high school. We were madd catching up. I ordered the Cobb Salad and DANG, it's hella salad.  There's enough of everything and the non-fat ranch made me feel better. LOL. BTW, I'm glad this restaurant started leaving the nutrition guide on the table. I'm seeing this more often in establishments.

This is one of the burger restaurant chains I don't mind coming to on a regular basis. Their turkey burger is pretty delicious and full of flavor. Service has never failed me and the prices are reasonable. Only downside to this location is the women's restrooms, it's pretty small and there's only 1 regular sink. Parking can be a bit of a hassle too since it's located within a mall so it gets all that traffic.  If you haven't tried Red Robin give it a shot, it's either a place you'll enjoy or a place you'll hate.
Bottomless steak fries... Yum Burgers with some pink.... Yum Beer.... yum More Steak fries please!.... nomnomnomnom HK's Parting Shot --  YUM

I love Red Robin.  This location is like the others.  The wait time usually is not that bad.  The service was good.  The food is always great.  The burgers are delicious and fries are scrumptious and BOTTOMLESS.  My wife loves the freckled lemonade.

Pretty darn good burgers! I had the Pub burger...changed my life. Next time ill ask them to throw a few jalapeno's on first. My wife had the Patty melt. she said it was really good, but a little too pink. But thats how she ordered it. We shared nachos as the appatizer, they werent what i would call memorable. Our son had a kids meal. 2 burgers, nachos , drinks and a kids meal came to around $43 dollars, not to shabby. With tip, it was more. I would have preferred a slightly lower price, but the food WAS good.

I just turned 30 2 weeks agao, and Red Robin gave me my only bday gift this year (besides this AWESOME home made card from the girlfriend!) ate here again cause guess what . . . sign up for their e-club and you get a FREE BURGER for your bday!. yup, don't even have to buy anything else! customize any burger to your liking, bottomless fries, what's not the love? 5 Stars for Red Robin just for the free caloric induced coma.

Fun, friendly atmosphere. Kid and family friendly. Love the colorful decor. The Steak Sliders were pretty good and so was the Cole Slaw. My family seemed to enjoy their burgers, fries and chicken strips. The kids meal comes with a free drink. I appreciate that. I liked sitting on the upper deck. The down side it that the burgers are pretty expensive. I usually don't like to pay $8-9 for a burger.

Floors were discussing today, my shoes kept slipping in mystery liquid, my table was sticky and the menu was also sticky. The food was good, but eating in a dirty area and on a dirty table is a real turn off. I love going to Red Robin and hope that this is not a trend for this location.

I have been to red robin a few times. Most the time was out of state, however, I have been to this location I would say, maybe 5 to 6 times. I would recommend tower of onion rings!! They are the bomb!! I usually order the mushroom burger, however, I stopped eating beef for a while now and I think I ordered the chicken club burger/sandwich. The chicken was very juicy which surprised me. Chicken breast always seem to be dry when it is prepared but not this time! To top it off, I love the unlimited amount of fries!!!!

I use to love this place when they first opened. The workers were soo much more nicer and approachable. But it's okay the food is still alright. I remember it being better but I guess it depends on what you order now. I always order the tower of onion rings. Love it. I still wonder what the other sauce is next to the ranch, it sort of tastes like bbq but it's not. The only thing I suggest getting here is one of their burgers. I got one of their salad wraps or w.e once it wasn't that great. I love their burgers though. My most recent order was their Chili Chili Cheese Burger. It was like heaven in my mouth. At first I was soo confused on how to eat it (I needed a knife) Haha The server failed to give me one but then he noticed real quick about it so it was good.  Another thing I love their bottomless fruity drinks (: Their fries are bottomless too but I don't really enjoy eating those kind of fries.

It's getting a two because of the food. I ordered the Burnin' Love and it was good, I've had better burgers elsewhere. The refill fries are in a smaller serving than I have seen at another Red Robin location. The restaurant is nicely themed and has interesting decor.  The staff is horrible. Our waitress was impossible to waive down, it seemed as if she was trying everything to avoid eye contact with us. At one point she was walking by, and I asked her for napkins and fries, but she did not hear the fries part because she didn't even stop to listen to what else I wanted, she kept on walking and left me talking by myself. If I had been by myself I would have walked out. Every time she came by I had to basically quickly yell what else I wanted so she could hear my requests as she would drop off things and leave. I know they're busy, but that was just ridiculous. Never going back to this location.

"Stop Drop shut em down open up shop..ohh nooo that's how Ruff Ryders roll."  That's what I think of when I hear "Double R". I can see DMX and his crew riding around on motorcycles and doing wheelies. Wait, that was so last decade! Now when I think of "Double R" I think of Red Robin. (Not to be mistaken for the Filipino bakery downstairs, Red Ribbon) GOOD: - Burgers are yums: had the A-1 peppercorn burger and last time ate some burger with a fried egg. (Royal Red Robbin) - endless fries: that can mean trouble. Keep them coming! - Parmesan Garlic Fries: tasty, make sure you bring the gum though. - Service: shoutout to our server Cher B. Thanks for taking care of us! Bad: - Calm down on the Parmesan Garlic fries! I can still taste the garlic in my mouth. Taste so good though! - Parking: are people still Christmas shopping!? I swear I could not find parking outside of the restaurant! Ugly: - I actually got recognized as a Yelper! I felt like a local celebrity. I even gave our waitress my autograph!(ok actually it was just me signing my bill) Nothing ugly to say about "Double R" Red Robin. Good burgers. Great staff. (Ask for Cher B.!) "Stop. Chomp. Endless Fries with ketchup on top! Ohhh yo! That's how Red Robin rolls!"

An utter disappointment. Maybe I'm spoiled by the many other delicious burger joints in San Diego, but my friend and I who dined here even compared it to McDonald's and sadly, we agreed at McDonald's would've been better.  The main point of our complaint was the food, we both ordered our burgers medium rare and the burger was overcooked therefore, they were burnt. The other problem with our burgers was the fact that it tasted PLAIN! The only flavor was the charred taste. I ordered the guacamole and bacon burger and there was such a thin layer of guacamole that I didn't taste it through the lettuce. The bacon tasted as though it was cooked once then microwaved and thrown into my burnt burger.  As for the bottomless fries, no one offered us a refill on them. Much less offered us more water to wash down the burnt flavor.  At the end of the day I would never return to this location nor would I recommend it to anyone... Unless burnt burgers with no flavor are your thing.

Khann and I really lucked out on a crowded Saturday night yesterday when we were looking for something to eat before watching TRON: Legacy at the IMAX theater. We were originally going to go to the Red Robin but parking was impossible at 6:30 at night so we tried the Outback Steakhouse. That was too crowded so we walked all the way to the Red Robin. First of all, I thought the entrance to the place was INSIDE the mall. It was just outside the sliding doors. But we lucked out. As soon as we went inside the kitschy place, we were immediately seated in a tiny table for two. Khann was initially going to order the spicy Buffalo wings appetizer but he was going to eat that dish alone because I can't handle spice. So he stayed away from all of the appetizers. I ordered the salsa and guacomole chips appetizer instead. Khann had one of the Red Robin Monster burgers, which I still maintain are gut-busting, heart attack type of foods. Disturbing to have such foods in midst of all the restaurant is promoting to kids. I wasn't in the mood for burgers. I realized what a mistake it was to go to this place when someone isn't in a burger mood. When you neglect the entire burger section of the menu, there's precious little alternatives to choose from. The last time I went to a Red Robin, it was in February and in Oregon and I was determined not to repeat the mushroom burger mistake. But there really wasn't anything appetizing in the rest of the menu. I ultimately ordered the Prime Rib Dip, which came as something that looked like an undersized Philly cheese steak. Ironically, Khann called his burger an oversized In-N-Out Double Double. The bread was so hard on my prime rib sandwich that I couldn't use my knife to cut through the bread. I didn't want to pick up the sandwich because there was a lot of grease on the bread. The only good thing for me was the rasberry limeade. Great drink. The fries were way too salty. The coleslaw was okay, but I'm not much of a coleslaw fan. The nachos and guac were good. Wow, the place is kitschy and way overdressed for Christmas. Do you really need all the dressing up and bells and whistles? There was a person a table over who had a birthday and instead of singing them the traditional song, the staff did some kind of weird drill chant. $40 for the two of us and the meal felt like a letdown.

My husband and I, along with our 5 month old, stopped in. I asked the host if it was at all possible to eat outside on their "patio" since we had a stroller, and out child was sleeping. (Any parent knows why this was important to us.) I explained that I worked in this business as well, and I knew it was busy and if it was a problem, I understood. She said she would ask the manager, which she did, and the manager, I was told, said yes. She told us to pick a place to sit, brought us menus, and told us she let the server know. We wait, and wait. I picked the seat near the door so we could see into the bar area and so we would be seen as well, just in case we would be forgotten about. I even went inside and spoke with the host again, in case she forgot we were there. We wait some more. I notice multiple servers and even a manger walk by the door and make eye contact with me. NO ONE EVER CAME!!!  I understand they were busy, but, being a service manager myself, if you notice people outside, maybe check on them or follow up with a server/manager. Or maybe the manager should not have said yes to the request if they couldn't handle it.  We finally left. We walked by 30 min later, our menus were still on the table. Thank goodness we didn't sit and wait longer. My husband and I were looking forward to a meal together, out in public! Any parent knows what a rare occasion that can be.  So, thanks Red Robin and the manager for making it a night to remember... wait, scratch that.... a night I hope to forget.

Ive been to this red robin various times.....so I'm just gonna say this here. Yesterday me and my boyfriend went to red Robin everything was awesome until my boyfriend found a thumb tack in his fries ...we only wanted to let them know so they could b more careful but we were super nice about it like "oh its okay we just wanted to let you know everything is great" so then the manager comes to our table really nice and everything until he proceed to tell us that he was trying to figure out where it came from as they have nothing that looks like that in the restaurant ....hinting that we put it there. Then he went on to tell my boyfriend that he would take the burger off and I was like no please don't do that....like I was so dumbfounded by how the manager was basically telling us we did it....Idk I got really sad :(

We came here for the first time and really enjoyed our experience. Deeone was our server and his enthusiasm for the food here was what inspired us to get what we got. He was kind and professional! They have rewards if you get the card and the restaurant was pretty cool inside. The food was ok, the presentation was nice but I have had better. They have bottomless fries but we were too full to even finish the ones we had. The appetizers we tried tho were delicious! I had a mix of mozzarella sticks and fried zucchini the batter was thin light and crispy just how I like it. We will go here again for the free birthday burger lol.

Mom:  "Where you going?" Me: "Red Robin's mock opening at Plaza Bonita!" Mom"  "I tot Red Ribbon is already open?" Me:  "No Mom, it's Red ROBIN, not Red RIBBON...ay naku!"  LOL!!! Welcome to Nasty City Red Robin!  You're going to confuse the hell out of many Pinoys in the hood because of the existing Red Ribbon Filipino bakery located in the same mall...lol! Thank you for inviting me and my friends to a complimentary dinner at one of your mock openings last week.  We were greeted by your über excited staff that just started their new jobs there and service from start to finish was wonderful! I would eat at your UTC location for lunch every now and then, but I never tried your burgers until now.  Boy oh boy do your burgers taste fantastico!  But the burger special with three deep-fried mozzarella sticks on your menu looks kinda freaky. It's cool you have a full bar, but no happy hour?  Oh well, you serve Grey Goose and a great selection of beers I like on draft, so that'll keep me coming back. Red Robin is a breath of fresh air at Plaza Bonita mall.  The mall has gone through a major remodel and having Red Robin as an available dining option in the South Bay gets a warm welcome from this gal! Red Robin-Red Ribbon...see, I'm freakin' confused and kept typing Red Ribbon as I wrote this review.  I want ube now. =P

We have gone a few times and we love their bottomless fries, I order their blue ribbon hamburguer with a side of onion rings.... wish those were bottomless too!!! they do offer a short tower of onion rings, my hubby had their regular hamburguer with fries all in all a good food and good experience.

My friends and I were just browsing thru the mall trying to relax for a bit and to get free samples from Wetzel Pretzel and Paciugo. My friend decided he wanted to try a burger from here so we went it.  The hostess who had a bright smile on her opened the door and handed me a balloon. Honestly, I have no idea why she handed me one and not my friends.  Anyway, it was my first time here and the interior was nifty and a cool style. This place had hundreds of posters all over the walls. It was entertaining admiring all the variety of artist on the walls. The upstairs section look cool too for more of a private experience, for sae, a date?  I was extremely surprised that they had a full bar. I never expected for them to serve beer and liquor. Two thumps up for the Fat Tire on tap.  My friend ordered the Big Cheeseburger with steak cut fires. However, I took several bites of his burger and and his fries. The fries were really good with Red Robyn seasoning and ketchup. The burger was pretty big(not as big as Islands) and it was tasty(Reminds me of Samuel L. Jackson in Pulp Fiction, Big kahuna Burger, haha) and one of the cool things was that the sodas are about $2.75 but with unlimited refills and so does the fries. Very cool! They tend to fill up the entire glass with ice. Not cool! So, Make sure to ask for easy on the ice.  The customer service was incredibly excellent. The entire staff was happy and friendly. And, the food got to us quickly.  I accidentaly told them it was my birthday and they brought over a free sundae and they offered to sing to me but I didn't want to take it that far.

Terrible terrible service burger was incorrect.  Never received a refill on my drinks untill I ordered, even then I didn't get it until I ordered my check.  While the food is good the horrible service does not make up for this place.  Management needs a huge revamp.

Hands down BEST place to eat for lunch! Burgers & Bottomless Fries...what more can u ask for!! Try the pomegranate margarita it's REALLY good. Love the servers in the bar area always have a Great positive attitude. :)

This was my first time at Red Robins, and it was not what I expected. Once we arrived the hostess just looked at us and asked us to follow her. There was no greetings or anything. We sat down and looked at the menu. I was definitely overwhelmed by the different items. Once I looked up the server came by to get our drink orders. Once she came back and gave us the drinks, we asked for a little more time. Couple of minutes had passed, and we waited until she got back to us. Each time; however, she passed out table she would tell us to wait as she served another table. Couple more minutes and we were again asked to wait and she'll be back. It was a total of three times we were told to wait. By the time she came by we were definitely annoyed. She took our orders, and I had ordered A bacon cheeseburger with a side of ranch. We waited about 15 minutes for the food to be prepared, but it was beyond disappointing. The burgers were small and about the size of in n outs burger. Unfortunately, she forgot about my side of ranch, and it did not bother me until I was practically almost done with my burger and fries.... We reminded her several times and by the time, I was on my last bite she had brought it out. I don't want to be charged extra for a sauce I was not able to enjoy. And Unlike the commercials, the hamburger was miniature and finished in just 5 bites. I am not willing to pay 11 bucks for not even a quality burger. This place is definitely lacking.

Not the best place in the world to get a burger, since it's part of a chain of restaurant and that never makes me a fan, that and the fact that the only sort of good beer is the Sam Adams seasonal lagers.. anywho... I'll give the place four stars mainly because you can make any burger a Vegan Pattie or a Gardenburger. As a vegetarian there are not so many places you can do that, and yo have to settle for the Veggie burger they have predetermined for you. Hey! Vegetarians want sauteed mushrooms, or jalapeño in our burger!  The server was nice, even tho we waited a bit for fries but it really didn't matter.. If you are going to share your burger, let the server know so they cut the burger for you and you don't have to get all messy in your table trying to cut the burger in half.. just saying!  Will probably come back, but no so soon.. tho the endless fries are very very tempting!

NOTE:  This is a four star for kiddos in mind, this is not a four star adult dining experience.  If you don't have kiddos, I'd say this is 3 Star, based on options, good food and SERVICE.  Every time I've been I've had GREAT service.  Pays to say thank you before you even start ordering :)     Attention parents!!!  Calling all parents!!!!  A kids menu under $5 that includes several options like non-fried foods, a side, including steamed plain broccoli and mandarin oranges, AND a drink either milk, choc. milk or juice.  This is a GREAT deal for the kiddos.  Also, if they want more, they will bring it.  Unlimited pastas that I know of for sure.  Maybe not another burger or chicken I'm guessing. I've been enjoying this location because it's not super busy, my kiddos love to play at the little playground in the mall and often I can run an errand at Target too.  I LOVE the red robin rewards!   On the burger front, let me just say that I wish they would stop asking me how I'd like it cooked?  I've been five times now and not once have they made it medium rare.  It's always well done.  SO, get some sauce, grab the salt and pepper and enjoy it for what it is.  A very neat place to enjoy a burger with friends AND your kiddos.   End of it all ask for a balloon for your kiddos on the way out or even on the way in; it's always a good thing for the kiddos. Average cost for two adults and two kiddos (without adult beverages) in the $30 - $35 range.  And I have to say WAY better than Denny's!!!!  Do yourself a favor and don't go to Denny's for lunch or dinner if you can hit up the Red Robin!

I have been a fan of Red Robin for a long time.  Good rewards program, bottomless fries, Guinness on Tap, good burgers with a variety to choose from, and a late happy hour.  Lately I have had a disappointing experience.   They no longer have Guinness on tap, straight out of the bottle, and while their burger selection is still pretty good, more often than not, my burger has been overcooked to burnt.  I ALWAYS ask for the burger "pink".  I have never gotten it the way I ordered it, but I can usually deal, most places have trouble cooking a burger with any rareness, so I am used to it.  On my last visit, rather than being even close to pink, it was charred around the outside and way over done.  Pretty much the opposite of what I asked for.   Because of this and a few other times the food was sub-par, I believe the  quality control has gone down hill.   So to sum up, Red Robin has gotten rid of two of my preferred menu items, Guinness on Tap, and French Onion Soup, burgers are not made as requested, and they really have not improved their menu with any of the recent changes made.   Given these developments, I will be looking for other places to spend my money.

I've eaten here before and had a pleasant experience. I came today for my son's birthday and we ordered burgers. We were seated quickly and served drinks immediately after we ordered them. Food took a bit longer than I would've liked for burgers but it wasn't too bad. Food came and was not bad. They serve steak fries and they are all you can eat fries so the initial portion with the meal is minimal but manageable. The waitress was attentive and my only issue was not having napkins or silverware at the table. It wasn't busy so there's really no excuse for missing that part. Overall a good experience and would come back again.
Just had lunch here it was pretty decent ..my chicken came out slightly under done but sh! $ happens no biggy the drinks were good my server/bartender was pretty chill and had good customer service

Burgers = good,  sandwiches = good,  endless fries =great,  endless root beer floats = AWESOME,  mac n' cheese = TOTALLY DISAPPOINTED!!! Went here 2 times. Service is swell and food presentation is fair. Its a decent place to try at least once. Very nice atmosphere to mingle with your friends and family and have a bite to eat. If you are into sports, good place to watch a game if your stomach craves burgers. I DO NOT recommend the mac n' cheese. I am a huge mac n' cheese fanatic and its literally blan here. It looks cheesy but no flavor. :'( I had the root beer floats and I felt like a kid all over again with infinite amount of drank! :P All in all go here to try it for your own opinion, but i only recommend trying the burgers and root beer floats.

I mean the food was good. I had a red robin royal burger on a gluten free bun, but idk. The service was ok and when I asked the female waitress if they had a steak knife I could use to cut my burger she gave me a butter knife. It took our waiter a longtime to bring us our check, then come and get it and mind you it wasn't that busy. Sorta a shame.

Love, love this place! My boyfriend and I come all the time. Bottomless fries?! Refill on fries has to be the best idea for a burger lounge. Red Robin has the best strawberry lemonade, "freckled lemonade," ever. Jalapeño coins are to die for if you like a hint of spice for an appetizer. Favorite burger would be the Cry Baby style on a Red Tavern's double. Definitely recommend you make a trip here!

Came here on a Thursday 11/21/13 at 11:45am for lunch. My server Lisa was super slow at everything. My appetizer plate came out dirty with old food on it. To top it off we had no utensils. Red Robin has good food but the service today was awful. I had to talk to three different servers to get what we needed.

I should be treated very well at this place for how often I bring my family here, but unfortunately, everything is wildly inconsistent.  The really awesome waiter always recognizes me and the fam but he even had an off-day once.  We've had him probably 10 times as our waiter, though, and I have written a note to the manager more than once letting him know how good this waiter is.  The portions change, there are a couple servers who deserve the 30% tip, and there are a couple it pains me to give them 15%.  The manager is accommodating and admits the inconsistency.  The big problem, however, is the manager.  He doesn't want the cooks to make the food how customers want it, which is how they make it when they aren't being micro-managed by this guy.  I asked him about a salad that usually has a bunch of chicken on it that my wife, 5 year old, and I (used to) love to split as an appetizer.  This particular instance it only had 1/3, maybe a 1/2, as much chicken as usual.  The manager's explanation was that he regulated how much chicken goes on the salad with the cooks.  Thanks for ruining your restaurant for us, manager.  Don't count on seeing our $60-100 every week ever again, bro.  Sometimes it was 2-3 times in one week.
Burgers here never disappoint. This place is smaller than most Red Robins though, other than that it's chill. Tv's are small but there's a lot and the bar is cool. Service is good too

I am changing my review from 3 stars to 1 star. I went here recently for lunch. The place was MAYBE 1/4 of the way full and I counted at least four waitresses and a hostess on the floor when I came in. I waited with my kids for about five minutes  before we were seated (and we were the only ones waiting). We were seated and the waitress took our drink order right away (we all just got waters). Those came quickly, she disappeared for about ten minutes and didn't come back for our food order until I ran out of water. She took our order, refilled my water and disappeared again. It took a good 25 minutes for our food to come out and I saw two tables that came in AFTER us get their food while we waited. My poor kids waited so patiently, I think they did better than I did. I was ready to leave when our food finally came out. It was good, but not worth the wait and low blood sugar.  My youngest had to go the bathroom, so I took both of my kids (they're young), leaving my sunglasses on the table. We passed our waitress, I informed her that we would be back in a minute. I don't know if she was spaced out or what, but we were in the bathroom for no more than 2 minutes and when we came out our table was cleared off, including my sunglasses. I sat down and waited for the disappearing waitress. I was there for a couple minutes, flagged her down and explained what happened. She disappeared into the kitchen and I waited another 7 or 8 minutes and never saw her or my sunglasses again :( I don't think I will ever be going back to this Red Robin. Or any of them. There are far better choices in San Diego.
Update: my friends and I returned and were given great service and loved our food! Thanks Annette!

Burgers are great, speciality drinks are delish, apps are small not filling which is perfect. My family loves coming here once a week and have a nice family dinner. It's perfect for kids and large party's.

The food here is terrible the veggie burger was a frozen patty no taste not cooked.The cod sandwich was decent at best the fruit salad was soggy and gross the fries were decent. The service was good and waiter was friendly.

I rate Red Robin a 2 because of the service. IT SUCKED ! The waitress kept leaving & not coming back at all & it lead to the point where we had to ask another worker for refills. Rude & horrible customer service at the one in the Plaza Bonita Mall. Overall, the experience from when you walk through that door is bad.

It was decent the first time I went, however the second time wasn't a very good experience.   The order came fast, which was good but the fries were cold.  I think instead of waiting until the burgers were done to serve the fries, they must have put the fries on the plate and waited, which made them cold.   The second time I went with my parents and my dad ordered the fish and chips, mom ordered the regular burger and I ordered what I like to call the cowboy burger.. which is onion rings, bbq sauce, etc. It's known as a cowboy burger originally.  The burger meat was over seasoned because it came out very salty.  The oil from the fat of the burger was soaking through the buns.  I couldn't finish the meal, only ate about half.   Later that night both my mom and I got sick.  We figured it was from the burger meat.  When I researched it, turns out a lot of people had that experience around the day we went.  Most likely a bad batch of meat.  My dad was fine but he ordered the fish and chips.  We never went there again, maybe in a couple years I'll give it another try but two bad experiences in a row is going to keep me away, especially that second experience since both my mom and I got sick that night.   The waitress was very nice though, a sweet older lady, we gave her a nice tip. You could tell she was working hard, probably had been there a while and was about to end her shift.  She was very nice as we explained that we didn't care for the meal.  We tipped her anyways because she was kind and it wasn't like she was the one cooking and preparing the food.

Was not happy with our Father's Day lunch here at Red Robin. My husband and I both ordered the Tavern Double.. who would've guessed it's actually a single patty? Our waitress told us next time, ask to add a patty. We believed her at the time although it seemed strange. When we got home I looked at the menu and it turns out it was supposed to be a double. So what the heck was she talking about?! We paid $10.99 for a burger when we should've gone to In-N-Out to get a much better burger for half the price. Also we weren't given any napkins for our meal and it took us a long time to see her come back around to our table to request some. We needed refills as well. We won't come back.

I am amending my review to 4 stars.  Tony went out of his way to make sure we had an excellent experience. His was attentive and quick. The wait is over 30 minutes.  They entire outside is empty. Won't seat anyone outside because they "want you to have the best experience and servers might forget you are outside "...REALLY?!

Honestly i hate going to places where you pay $15 on a burger, and this is just the place. In and out is way better in terms of taste and price. First of all they don't even have sweetened tea and sorry but what kind of restaurant doesn't have sweet tea. I ordered a whiskey river bbq burger as it was a "red robin favorite" and there was literally no bbq sauce on it, the onion strips were SO salty my throat started to hurt, the meat wasn't even that great, there was old wimpy small strips of lettuce, and sad cheap looking buns. My friend next to me ordered a bowl of clam chowder and there was an eyelash on the inside of her bowl. Gross. My dad ended up paying $115 on a few burgers and fries that didn't even taste that great. Sorry but I'm never coming back here.

I am surprised I have not reviewed about Red Robin.  I like Red Robin.  Personally, I think it beats eating at Johnny Rockets.  I always ask for my burger well done and the patty always comes out juicy.  Their strawberry lemonade is great too.  It comes out with real strawberries too.  They are possibly frozen with preservatives, but it doesn't matter, it's strawberry lemonade and it is delicious.   I also like how I can personalize my burger.  For example, if you do not want the hamburger buns, you can eliminate it and have it wrapped in lettuce.  You can also substitute the fries with steamed vegetables too without paying more.   Service can be a hit or miss.  Sometimes the waiter or waitress is on top of things and refills your water without asking, but sometimes you need to wave to the waiter/waitress.  Sometimes they will ask you, "How is everything?" and sometimes they will not.

Horrible!!!  How they can pass these burgers off as "gourmet" is beyond me!  Tasteless, and way overpriced.  The only thing I could taste was tomato and a cold stale bun.  The onion rings were good but overall was very disappointed.

First time at a red robin ever and it horrible. . First off walked in and a family with 3 babies and 3 women were in front of us. A woman (I'm assuming the hostess or a waitress) came up to the counter and didn't say anything but just stared at us. I had to say that the women with kids were there before us. She sat them and walked behind the line (where they prepare food ). My husband and I then stood at the door waiting to be seated for 5 minutes. MIND YOU THE RESTAURANT IS DAMN NEAR EMPTY. So I was pretty confused and pissed to see that we weren't being seated. My intentions were to leave then but my husband said let's just go sit at the bar. So we sit there and wait for another 5 minutes for a waitress to acknowledge us. She finally brings us menus and water. I don't know her name because she didn't introduce herself. We ordered pretty quickly and got our appetizer fast. I saw the manager walking around finally in her pink polka dotted shirt speaking to various tables but never came to ours. My burger was salty but still ok. I order the tavern double with grilled mushrooms. I'll come back when you guys decide that you want to have a proper hostess who will sit us since she clearly did see us or i'll just got to another location.

Bottomless GARLIC steak fries!  I like to order the bottomless GARLIC steak fries. I'm not a fan of just regular steak fries cause it's so easy for them to end up dry. I don't know, it might just be me. The garlic steak fries have, of course, garlic and shredded cheese sprinkled on top. BOMB! But at the table, there's a bottle of seasoning which you must add! They offer you the choice of ranch as a side, and they already have ketchup available at the table. When I'm full, I always ask for another order of garlic steak fries, then take them to go right after. Mwuahaha.  They currently have the Oktoberfest Burger for $6.99. It has swiss cheese, beer mustard grilled onions and black forest ham on toasted pretzel buns. The burger was pretty good. Kinda small, tbh, and the buns might be a bit hard since it's toasted and pretzel buns. To me, their burgers are alright, but I was completely satisfied as I was starving. If you ask to have your burgers cut in half, they wrap each half individually so it's less messy to eat.  I've also tried their Burnin' Love Burger, at roughly $8 if I remember correctly. It has fried jalapeno rings, salsa, and spicy pepper jack cheese on top of their seasoned beef. This burger was pretty good! The jalapenos are questionable, but it definitely works. It gives the burger an extra kick. If you don't mind a bit of spiciness in your burger, then you def gotta try this one out.  I love the liveliness of this Red Robin. There are random frames all over the walls, and I love that you'll honestly never get bored cause there's always something new to look at. Great location for friends and family. Very enjoyable. NOTE: parking is definitely an issue.

Not bad for a chain joint. Not great for a food snob. I would never come here of my own accord, but I always enjoy it when other people are craving it and bring me along.  I have eaten here several times. My best experience was this last time. They have a special "Berserker Burger" on the menu to promote some action movie that's coming out. I subbed the veggie patty in for the meat patty. Other than that, I left it as it is on the menu. The burger has spicy onion straws and a few others things on it. The flavors are really well balanced, and it has a good amount of heat while still tasting like a burger.  Fries are bottomless, and the drinks just keep on coming. Definitely a step up from the food court nearby.
Jose the older gentlemen is very slow and will get ur order wrong nd tell u ur wrong, however the manager Ruben was very great made our terrible experience a little better thank u for that

Red Robin Today was great! Super crowded but the food and service was very welcoming and timely. We had the chop house burger and the bleu burger with bottomless sweet potato and steakhouse fries. We never saw the bottom of our beverages or fries. Burgers very tasty and prepared as requested. They were on it all during the visit. We would return and likely very soon.

This red robbin is great to include the managers and 99% of their staff.  There is only one rotten apple. Stay clear from the server with the attitude, NAYLIA.  This is the second time we have had her and the same attitude.  I told her to cut my burger as I would share it with my daughter.  She then said it would be an extra charge.  Get the hell out if town! An extra charge for cutting my burger.  I don't think so.  She then cut me off when I was explaining I wanted extra fries w my meal as we usually devour the fries in 5.2 seconds:) yes, she has much attitude!  I asked for the manager and we were accommodated by having another server attend us the rest if the evening and the manager apologized for her and was very attentive with anything else. Make sure you don't get her as a waitress or your experience will be a 1! This red robbin is the best!

Everyone 21+ get the Blue Haze drink its so tasty! Loved my waitress Maira B. She was attentive, a great server, whatever we asked for it didn't take long. We've never tried the sweet potato fries and she brought a basket free of charge. Overall it was a great day!

This place can get super busy. My husband and I went in for dinner on a Friday night and only had to wait 20 minutes when the place was packed. Not a bad wait time for a Friday night! Good was good, service was decent. Waitress was super nice. Over all I'm going back. Def recommending this place to my friends.  Had the Cab o wabo salad and my husband had the patty melt.  Both very good!

Came here for Veterans Day and the place is packed the food still manage to come out in a decent time cooked the way I wanted it and the server did not even let my cup get half full. Although I still consider this fast food the restaurant was very clean the employees were very welcoming and professional I didn't mind giving me a good tip because they were deserving of it.
Gina is a very good waitress

The strawberry freckled lemonade is always A MUST at any Red Robin. I like that this location is two-stories allowing for more seating.
