Unfortunately, some of the tables do look like they're positioned a lil too close together. Loved our waiter's Aussie accent and the service he provided was decent.  Each time he checked on our table he would double-check if there was anything we needed before he went off to his other tables.  But I wish he came around more often to refill my drink.. I ordered the Burnin Love Burger and that should have been an indication to always check if I needed a refill.  Yes, I'm more important than everyone else.. get over it! :) JUST KIDDING!! but I was dying of thirst towards the end of my meal!  The two stars is really for the long strand of black hair we found in my mom's burger.  BLECK!  Needless to say, the meal was comp'd, as it should be, and, in addition, the manager offered us a free meal to go.

On our way to a concert, we decided to stop here for dinner. It was still early so the dinner rush had not started. We were seated in the bar area by the hostess. Our server came over and took our drink order and then returned for our food order and that was the last time we saw her. Someone else brought out our food and we had to ask another server for refills of our drinks. No one checked to see how our food was...no sort of serve whatsoever. Normally when a server leaves for a break or end of shift they stop by with their relief and let you know who will be helping you...nothing. We had been done eating for probably 10 min, our plates had been cleared and we were looking for someone to get us our check so we could go. Very disappointed in the service especially considering it was not busy. The meal itself was good, but poor service would turn me off to visiting again

Red Ribbon and Red Robin are in the same mall. *snicker* I haven't been to a Red Robin in ages! It had been so long that I didn't remember what to really expect at this establishment except for burgers. The family and I were starving, so we decided to pop into Red Robin. I was so tempted to take the seasoning home for myself. It's so good ;_;  I ended up sprinkling it everywhere! Bottomless beverages are the way to go. My sister and I shared a Peachy Keen Splash: so refreshing. It even has little diced peaches in it! Definitely recommend that as a beverage of choice. I ended up ordering the Royal Red Robin Burger, in which I got K.O.'d after a couple of bites. Grease central! Total grease central. I ate all of my fries (that were doused in seasoning), but the burger...oh man, that totally got the best of me. It does make for some great leftover food, though. Mmmm. Greasy burgers + endless fries + that addicting seasoning = awesome.
Jennifer was my waitress and she was so GREAT!! Very down to earth and she was on top of re filling my freckled lemonade :)
Burgers is okay, Fries is thick and yummy, the service can use some improvement. I wouldn't  eat there  all the time unless I am really craving for their Fries "just saying".

Horrible service tonight. Actually we didn't even get seated. Got there at 10pm to avoid the crowd. Lots of empty tables not enough servers. Waited 30 minutes for a table of three. So looking forward to bottomless rootbeer floats. Had to go to El Torito instead.  Got seated and ordered in less than 10 minutes. You disappointed tonight Robin.

mmm bottomless garlic fries & sliders were tastyyy! split it with my friend, and was full! also tried my friend's strawberry lemonade? IDK,  it was SOME GOOD STUFF!!! :) friendlyy waitress, and good atmosphere!
It was a busy night so i assume thats the reason the our app came out the same time as dinner. No worries im sure ill still go back.

The best service and the cleanest establishment out there are NOT worth food poisoning!  My Mom, sister, son and I went to Red Robin this past weekend.  My Mom and I shared the Burning Love Burger and I ordered it well done.  It came with a little pink.  My sister ordered the burger with the fried egg. I ate most of the burger as my Mom also had a salad.  Towards the end of the meal I started to feel a little "off" but chalked it up to just being tired from waking early.  The rest of the day I felt worse and worse and by the end of the day I was literally living in the bathroom, throwing up.   My Mom felt fine but woke up the next morning and started to feel the same way.  We both had all the classic food poisoning symptoms.  My 1 year old son had a couple of tiny bites of my burger, THANK GOD he has been fine so far.   Definitely should not have had any pink in my well done burger but it could also have been the mayo sauce on the burger or cross contamination, who knows.  But all in all I am going to file a complaint tomorrow - now that I can actually hold my head up without feeling dizzy.

Food was good. Only thing was the service. This is my 2nd time here and service is bad. Both times here they were under staff. So 2nd here and there was only one waitress for about 10 tables. Just hate waiting for a server.

I am an absolute borders-aholic, so everytime i go to borders at plaza i always pass by red robin and it seemed pretty interesting, considering i kept seeing their commercials on t.v and didn't know where one was in sight. Anyways, boyfriend's fam wanted to go out to eat and we all went to Red Robbin, we got there a bit late due the horrible parking spaces (there were none, seems like all the san diegans came out since the rain stopped all at once).  Once we got in there it was pretty packed but the atmosphere seemed pretty cool it kinda reminded me of a toned down Corvette dinner and a bit busier than a Ruby's.  Their food was pretty good, they didn't have much of a selection of pastas then again they specialize in burgers. I ordered the California Style Burger (at least i think thats what its name was, had guac,bacon, lettuce and tomatoes).  It was pretty good, nothing out of the ordinary, the fries were awesome, considering i am a fan of steak fries. But let me say I don't know our server's name, but she was a sweetheart.  Awesome service, pretty good food and nice atmosphere.

Grease City. We were in the mood for burgers and came here after shopping. A good choice for a cold, rainy night. Talking with the server, she told us she was from Michigan and that she didn't dig the crazy drivers.  Chit-chat aside, the food was typical of a Red Robin. The server was cool and didn't charge us for our drinks. Not too shabby.
Friday night, great service food was good, place is clean and the prices are very reasonable.

LOVE the Blue (blue cheese lover) Ribbon Burger. about $9.00 and comes w/ fries.... YUMMY!!  Bottomless soda drinks and Steak fries( regular or Parmesan garlic) and don' t forget the red robin seasoning powder... UMMMM!  We have been to this restaurant about 6 times since they opened and have yet to find a burger ( $7 - 10) we didn't like!  We have tried the burgers and wraps ...they are very fresh and filling!  The staff is very friendly, warm and accommodating.  Red (the bird dressed costume guy) is cute and friendly .Kids seem to really enjoy his interaction at your table. They have FREE latex branded balloons for kids. The kids menu $ 4 - 6 is pretty good (chicken fingers, pizza, mac n cheese, spaghetti comes with a side of veggies or fruit) and has a nice take home plastic red robin cup with a lid!  On the last couple of visits in March a manager came by to check on us and gave us scratcher cards.. we won a FREE soda drinks for later use in April, we thought the sctratches were a little odd. They also have a BIRTHDAY club- FREE BURGER or can be used for a free wrap also. Need to sign up
I love me some Red Robin!!! The thing I like the most is the strawberry lemon aid...... So very yummy !! And I always order the blta which is always very good.

eh...this place was okay.  Went there for the first time last night for dinner.  It was recommended by a huge Burger Buff that i know.   Unfortunately, i did not like the burger i got at all.  Another thing is that I'm not really into steak fries.  So maybe my review is being a little harsh (formerly 2 stars and now to three) .  I also gotta keep in mind that I just got the regular burger so that I can taste the quality of the patty.   If you're a burger buff, this place is definately worth a try, and there's some cute asian chick that works there too.  haha...

Great place for a quick burger and/or chicken sandwich. Sweet potato fries are worth the  additional $.79, they even offer free refills on fries. Although after half of a chicken sandwich I was full, the proportions are perfect for Greg (the food) Train.

Great Food! But what's wrong with this location!? I recently discovered that  this location--a bit of a drive from my home. I've been somewhat disappointed.  The first few times were unremarkable. Not great, not terrible. My last visit the restaurant ran out of spinach and artichoke dip. Isn't that like a favorite everywhere? ...and I have never understood restaurants that run out of food. What's up with that?  Today I had a sweet server who just couldn't get it right. Nothing came as ordered or when ordered. Never did get that lemon I asked for in my beverage. I had to ask for a refill, for napkins, then for silverware. Each time the server left the table to get what she forgot previously she'd be sure to serve several other customers first. I don't understand why someone who was just seated is getting their beverage before I get mine when I asked for one before they were seated.  To top it off it took for ever to get my appetizer. I asked for a side of Baja Ranch, which apparently they ran out of and were making. I was told 20 minutes into my service. The server scurried off before asking if I'd like a replacement. Now 30 minutes into service I'm still waiting for the ranch that I had to beg for as a replacement. I'm just sitting here waiting for something to dip my fry's into and they are getting cold.  If RR didn't have great food they would get one star. If I rated the food today...they'd get one star. The burger was dry with little of the promised sauce that the burger normally has on it.  It's not busy here, but the service is a disaster and there isn't a manager in sight to ask to correct things. I'm afraid my server might get lost on the way to the kitchen and back if I ask her to find the manager. Wait!? Actually I'm not sure she even works here--she's so lost she may have even found herself at the wrong restaurant today!  I wish I'd gone to Carl's Junior for a steakhouse burger and saved my money!!! I'd have paid a lot less to get my order wrong.  Oh by the way! There's my Ranch and she tells me "It's just regular ranch." Too bad my lunch hour is over. If you're a server and wonder why you get stiffed--this is why!? I really do want to give you a nice 30% tip, but with this service I think you ought to pay me.

So I've been to this location twice. The first time I had EXCELLENT service (our server turned out to be a lead server) and the second time the service was SHITTY.  My first visit was awesome! Our server recommended things on the menu, took our orders down quick, food came out quick, ba da bing, done!   The second time around after me and my boyfriend were seated, we sat down and took a look at the menu. The server took FOREVER to come by and get our orders. The burgers took FOREVER to come out. She never checked on us to see how we were doing. Never came by to refill our drinks, except before we were about to leave. She didn't even smile once. And she talked to us like she hated her job.  Overall, good burgers but not reliably good service.

I grew up around a Red Robin so I already knew what to expect. Their burgers are good and they offer a decent variety on the menu. The service was good and very accommodating. I will return to this location again.

About time! This was my second attempt here and this time we were able to not only be seated in a timely manner, but also had a pretty awesome server. The hostess tried to ensure that we had a handicap accessible table due to the fact that my grandmother was dining with us and she uses a walker which takes up more room and also means that my grandmother needs to be able to get in and out of her seat with ease. In regards to the food my daughter ordered a Black Pepper Bacon burger on ciabatta which she loved. She said it was cooked to perfection. My grandma got a simple double cheese burger from the kids menu which was just the right size since she doesn't have a huge appetite. As for myself I ordered the Southwest Grilled Chicken Salad without beans, I wish the description would've mentioned it had onions... Since I hate onions. Thankfully it didn't have much and I was able to pick them out and the chicken was perfectly grilled and nice and moist.

Glad I came back!  Don't remember why I didn't like it the 1st time.... But, I'll be returning!!  =)  The hubby and I shared the fried zucchini appetizer, YUMMERS.  We then each had a side salad (HUGE).  Then decided to share the prime rib dip sandwich.  I had mentioned to the waitress that we were planning to share the plate.  She brought it to us already divided (with no additional charge). We each had our own au jus and fries.  Really nice experience.  Plus the unlimited fries is a BONUS!!  =)
Havent been to a red robin where the food sucked. Always good service. Never sent food back. Yum
Been going here for years...but lately the service has dropped off a bit???  The food is always good and we love the atmosphere, so we will defintely be back!

We have always loved Red Robin... you can't beat their freckled lemonade and bottomless steak fries!!  I have always had the Royal Red Robin burger which is topped with a fried egg... delicious!  This time I decided to stray from the burger and had their Cod Fish sandwich, which was really good!  My husband had the mushroom burger, always good with their jamaican rum shake.... yummy!!  Our kids love this place... good kids meals and balloons!!  We will be back!!

It's funny how we can travel hours away from home, and the best food in the area is Red Robin!  I had the chicken caprese sandwich - soft ciabatta, balsamic vinaigrette, soft mozzarella, and chicken with pesto.  All this with a double side of broccoli!   My friend said that her cheeseburger was amazing, and that it was super thick too.  Unlimited fries and unlimited drink.  Unfortunately, our server was doing bartending duty too, so we didn't really get any refills.  Great food though.

How powerful is advertising these days? By the commercials, you would think this place should be on everyone's Bucket List. Actually going there, however, you might use a bucket for other reasons........OK that is a little harsh but this is the world's most average burger place. I just don't get the hype. The only thing I would call delicious there is the fish and chips. Shouldn't the burgers be great at a BURGER JOINT? Someone across from us ordered a rootbeer float that looked MMM MMM MMMM in a huge, tall mug, but again, shouldn't the burgers have that reputation at a BURGER JOINT? If you are craving a special burger, this is not where you should go. If you crave loud kids, TVs everywhere and run of the mill food, go to Chuck E Cheese.

The burgers are ok compared to fast food joints but as a restaurant style burger it lacks variety . The bottomless fries is a cool option but they over salt them so much i end up shaking the salt off. The onion tower has a cool presentation but there is nothing special about the flavor. Service is always good and the ambience is ok for just a quick stop, but when it comes down to the burgers is just meh.The drinks are waaay to sweet too for my taste :/

The bleu ribbon burger is to die for! I got mine with some onion rings and a side of ranch, yummm! The service is always great, not to mention the refills on drinks are endless and quick. The bill took a little bit longer than expected but it was a busy hour.. So I'll give them that.

The environment is great. Waitress was nice, food came fast but, whats up with the portions? Totally not enough food for what you pay for. They gave me like 10 pieces of nasty potato wedges for $10.(And it was in a basket)  I got my little one a spaghetti meal with a side of oranges and they gave her a tiny bit of spaghetti sauce and a TINY serving of oranges.  I'll never go there again. At least any in SD.

After my daughter and I go back and forth with deciding where to eat...She heads out to Plaza Bonita Mall...ok..."so you wanna go back to John's pizza?"..."No way!...It's a million kids in there by now,last time those kids had a Peanut  war with the peanuts that they baked into those pizzas remember?".........uh uh!..So we park outside of Target's back Entrance and hit the escalator.."Let's go Here....... I look above the Door..."Red Robin?".."You've eaten here b4?.."Yeah we come here a lot on the weekends"....Ok- I thought to myself,I've heard of it...why not?...We get in....here goes: I could have sworn I heard angels singing, it was so clean!-1st star! "Hi you guys..for here?"..."yes!"...Would you like a booth?.Whaaaat?..A Booth is my favorite spot!..You get Great customer service when you walk in the door?..Oh hell yeah --Star # 2! The lighting was Hip and Colorful!..Yep,Ikea musta cut a deal with sooome-body!...I saw no less than what seem to be 200 pictures of all artistic thoughts...I Loved it!...Your eyes?.. will never tire!...They have a perky life size Red Robin giving you the "thumbs up" for coming!... Cute!...TVs all over the place...mostly sports tho, men are so spoiled!.....Our waitress came over...quiet girl,but sweet...got our drink orders and off she went...I got  the coldest beer (on Tap) I could remember in a long time! (Yeah yeah-sue me!)...Ah rum...she then took our food order and was gone again!...Efficiency!?..Child I loved it!... I made sure I watched EVERYTHING too!....The waitresses,The Waiters,The Busboy,The Bartender,The Cooks on a hustle in the kitchen...(I paused to hear.."order up",but i wasn't  that lucky!)...It was like a symphony! It  didn't take THAT long to get our food, but a waiter made sure we were not forgotten.."Have you ladies been helped yet?...We assured him that we were, and he assured US that our food was on the window and headed our way...Oh sweet customer service from Heaven!....Thanks  Antonio!...Everything was SOOO good!...The Chicken Clukkers!..Funny Menu!.....They were Good!...fried just right and  tender inside!....She got the BBQ Burger,I tolja...she doesn't get IT yet.(she could do a BBQ burger at home!?)...but I let her, do her!...She says it was really good...she couldn't eat it all,they have really big burgers!...We saw all kinds of customers, from all walks of life!...An Eclectic crowd!...awww what joy to unite in the name of food!...They have nice kid friendly portions w/cute cupz  that made the children seated behind us so happy to be there!... The Wi-Fi was good, altho they could hit the top 100 and still please everyone.I guess by giving them 4 stars...you can  say I was actually Pleased with EVERYTHING for a change!...Now the waitress of the hour goes to....Drum Roll Please!?...-Tammmmmyyy!...She wasn't our waitress but i watched her style...She greeted her table with..."Thank you for choosing Red Robin,have you eaten here b4?...and if so, do you know where you wanna start?"...They were ALL good Becky and Marta as well!..Now for your missing star?...one of your waitresses needs to be RE-trained...I overheard her table complaining about her and they were right!....In her defense maybe she was having a bad day..*shruggz*...I loved my experience at Red Robin,and  I'll be sure to tell everyone i Know what a nice place it is!

I think this place is average. I mean, food is not bad, but there are better places out there. Prices are not that attractive either. I can get a better tasting burger for a better price at fuddruckers.
I love the fact that they have bottomless fries and the server was courteous and knowledgeable.  However, the burger was nothing special.

I think the burgers (for the price) are not that good at all. In & Out tastes 100 times better and cheaper .Fries are endless AND GOOD  drinks are pretty good . But if a fast food joint is better and CHEAPER than you we have a problem !

Such a fan... Can't go wrong with huge greasy beefy burgers and an endless supply of seasoned fries!!! The decor is fun, there is an upstairs balcony that you can sit on or down stair. A Big Red Robin is walking around greeting everyone and taking pictures with the kids. Wait time is a bit, but there is enough going on in  this restaurant to keep you entertained while you wait. I ordered the Burnin love burger with fried jalapenos, and pepper jack cheese with chipotle mayo on a jalapeno infused roll...  My mouth was on FI-YA! but boy was it good. Couldn't even finish half of it so I took it home, didn't re heat so well later so I didn't end up finishing it... next time I'm ordering off the kids menu!
I don't need to write a huge review to say this. THIS PLACE IS GREAT Nuf said

my first time at a Red Robin! Pros: Bottomless soft drinks (freckled lemonade and rootbeer floats included!) Bottomless Fries (w/burgers) Good food Cool-looking facilities Good service Cons: Went there close to closing and didn't have enough time to fully take advantage of the bottomless lemonade and garlic fries i got!.. :'(  ... lol
service is hit or miss here but I will still go in when I am at the mall.

Two words... FOOD POISONING!    I went and had the turkey burger, tried to eat a little on the healthy side since most of their burgers have 1200 or more calories in them.  Big Mistake!  Let's just say I will not be going back to Red Robin ever again.  Service was alright, but that did not make up for my 21 trips in the span of 24 hours to the bathroom.

pros... very friendly wait staff, and love the t.v. embedded into the ground when you walk in.  love the ability to be seated outside and watch the traffic go on by, love to watch people jostle for a parking space in the small lot outside.   the food is actually pretty good, burgers are cooked to order, and love the stack of onion rings that they serve with different sauces.  also love that you can drink all you want, even the fancy drinks too.  all in all a nice addition to the south county.  since this is probably the most southernly red robbin around.  i ordered chili cheese burger and some seasoned fries with garlic and cheese.  all good.   cons... small parking lot which you have to get lucky to get a space.  because if you can't park you can't eat.  bathroom was a bit on the sloppy side, they were running out of paper towels from the automatic dispenser.

Red Rob-bin...YUM! I love singing this little jingle...it gets stuck in my head! Okay, so I know there are better burger spots in SD...BUT when you are in the mood for some endless, golden, piping hot, seasoned, steak fries, then you should come here. Whenever I am having a good fry craving, I have to come here. They are always served fresh and hot and with the tasty Red Robin seasoning that I know people steal...I have seen a few in cupboards at people's houses! The burgers are also great..I love the variety and that you can go from veggie, turkey, and chicken, to meat or even fish! This new Red Robin is pretty nice and has two stories. If you want to celebrate a kid's (or adult's) birthday, you could probably request the area upstairs so you can have your own space and be loud and crazy as the waiters sing their crazy happy happy birthday songs.  I really liked it here because we came on a very busy night and the hostess was not opposed to giving me and my friend a nice roomy booth for a party of 5 even though we were still waiting on the others in our group. Many places like to be snooty and only seat you when everyone is present. When we were seated, our waitress, Erin was SUPER DUPER nice and kept giving us basket of endless fries as we waited for our other friends to arrive. She even gave us separate dipping sauces for each person when we asked for ranch and honey mustard. I've been to the one in La Jolla and the waiters get annoyed when you ask for early fries before your meal. I also hate when the basket has like 5 fries in it so you feel like you keep bugging them by asking for more. Instead, our waitress kept 3 baskets steadily refilled on the table and when she had to go on break, the waiter who took over was just as nice. Our group stayed until closing and we were never rushed out, we were still asked for refills for drinks and fries, and just had a wonderful dinner catching up with old friends. The waitress and waiter had a lot to do with our positive experience...their sincere generosity earned them a good tip and a good review, so we will be back soon....Red Rob-bin...YUMMMMM!

Went out with a group of 5 friends. Happy hour was nice but expected a shorter wait. Took an hour and a half. I got the blue cheese. I wasn't happy with the taste. Too much blue cheese. The mushroom was also covered in mushrooms. Service took a long time. Rootbeer floats looked good but over charged for "monster" shakes. Food didn't set well afterward

I went to Red Robin with a few friends, we were promptly seated, they almost immediately took our drink order and checked to see if we would like any appetizers prior to our meal..... we after 5 minutes decided what we wanted to order, the waitress saw that we sat our menu's down, she was there 30 seconds later, took our order, she was very friendly and polite, the order was placed, we were talking for less than 10 miuntes and the food was on our plated in front of us.....  she advised us that not only were drins to be refilled for free (normal) but that the friees were also bottomless, she checked back several time delivering drinks before they were close to empty and asking if we would like more fries, the service was fantastic, the food was pretty good for hamburgers also.... all in all was a good experience for a busy restaaurant in a mall.... I will eat here again, only 1 mile from home too..
Host was awesome. Decor is pretty awesome. It was my first time there earlier tonight... Our waiter was not all there. Kind of crappy service. Sorry red robin. Cool place the onion rings were good.

There is a glimmer of hope in the South Bay for good customer service. Went here for the first time with my 10 year old niece. It was an impulse decision but a good bonding time for us. The hostess opened the inside doors for us and we were quickly seated. The waitress came up quickly and kind of explained the menu and everything (I wasn't paying too much attention, sorry). While my niece and I debated on the food and drinks a weird thing caught my attention, a TV in the waiting area. The decor was cute a mix of older and new. I ordered the Chili Chili Cheeseburger with steak cut fries that had parmesan and herbs on it and my niece had the Bacon Cheeseburger with regular steak cut fries. My burger was nice and juicy but a little greasy due to the chili in it but good none the less. Midway through my meal the waitress brings another soda because "my ice had melted." That was pretty awesome, I just take forever to drink when I'm eating so this was a nice thought but it did make me feel like I had to finish the one I started with. My niece and I both waddled out of our booth and through the mall (thank goodness we parked by Macy's so we could walk some of it off) very content with our meal.  Thank you Red Robin for training your staff well and helping me gain 5 lbs.

I give this place a 3.5.  I think the service can definitely change.  I've been here a couple of times and sometimes it's hard to just get a refill on water and what I didn't like is yesterday I went and the waitress didn't bother on taken our finished dishes to help clear the table a little.  I know it's busy but you see a crowded table offer to take old dishes off the table.  The food is ok. The salads come with iceberg lettuce. And the mud pie with ice cream... Well there were freezer burns on the ice cream.  It was so hard to break into.  Honestly I just come here for the burgers, bottomless fries and drink and not to mention the campfire sauce.  Aside from that it's an ok place.

The food looks really good...on the menu. When it got to our table it was cold and chewy...like ordering taffy and not a burger.  I liked the lighting and the memorabilia on the walls. Our waiter had a pretty cool accent but I don't like to pay for accents. Bring me good food!  This place miserably failed. Our waiter didn't pay attention to us at all.  He just took our order and did a Houdini after that.  No refills on our drinks nor silverware for our rubber burgers.  The only reason this joint is getting 2 stars is because the kiddos got balloons and the milkshakes were pretty tasty.

I was really disappointed in the new Red Robin in Bonita Plaza, National City. My granddaughter got a milkshake that tasted like it had some kind of stuff dropped in her shake that shouldn't have been there, burnt electrical. This is just my personal opinon but it seemed to me that the burgers were precooked and then put on the grill for warm up I have eaten at Red Robins in other states and had delicious food so I don't know......

I have to preface by saying I usually love Red Robin! Love the food and before this week, it was always great service. We've had Maggie as our waitress on more than 5 occasions and she is the best waitress. Always helpful and kind, bringing refills before we even ask and remembering special orders perfectly.     This past week we had a differnt waitress and I'm trying not to be bias but the service was awful. We kindly asked for fries when we ordered our meal. We waited about 10 minutes, never got any. Our meal came 15 minutes after ordering but still no fries. We kept trying to flag down the waitress but she kept walking by, looking away. Finally half way through our meal we got her attention. We asked for the fries along with some ketchup and drink refills since both our drinks were empty. On this particular night it a Thursday and not nearly as crowded as it was when we've still had EXCELLENT service with Maggie. Well we finished with our meal and still didnt get the fries. The waitress finally brought the bill along with a basket of fries, no ketchup and did not refill the drinks.         We put our credit card in the folder right away as we didnt want to wait another 15 minutes for her to come by and pick it up, but she turned and walked away even though we put the credit card in the folder in front of her. A few minutes later, a waiter came by and took the folder with our credit card for us. Our waitress brought back the folder with the receipt.        The next morning when we went to use the credit card at Home Depot we realized it was not in my husband's wallet. Red Robin was the last place we used it. After thinking about it I am positive they did not bring the credit card back in the folder with the receipt. There is no way we would have left the credit card on the table.       I called Red Robin to ask if they had the credit card and they said yes, but did not apologize at all. I asked to speak to the manager, told him politely that the service on this occasion was poor quality and that they didnt even bring the credit card back. He turned things on me and said "it's ok you forgot your card, I understand you probably busy." I felt like saying, "no I wasnt busy, the waitress was so busy she didnt provide good service OR bring the credit card back." We had to cancel the credit card and order another. Not a huge problem but really not what I expect when I go out to eat. We were disappointed in what used to be one of our favorites.

Food was okay. They're garlic topped fries are yummy. But the reason I give them two stars is because I ordered a shake and as the waiter was making it at the bar it just sat in front of him while he talked over it for a long while to the bartender. Yuck. Made me lose my appetite. They need to serve their drinks right away instead of letting it sit and gather spit.

Decent place to fill a burger fix. Lots of interesting combinations and even one that has an egg on it. I'm not a fan of this style of fry, I prefer thin and crispy. Why 4 stars for a restaurants with "decent' burgers and fries I don't care for? I had a great experience. I like the open welcoming setup. Was there after a visit to the mall, got in quick, waitress was attentive. They messed up and didn't sub rings for fries and they fixed that and we kept them both. The BIG seller for me is that my cup was never empty. This waitress was on the top of her game with refills. I drink ALLOT and I drink fast. Water, Soda, Beer it doesn't matter. At most restaurants it is a waiting game. I'm sure most waitresses HATE guys like me that are high maintenance in the refill department but this waitress was on it. I was here about 6 months ago and I wish I got her name because she deserves some credit for impressing me with her refill skills.

This place is honestly good. The scene is very family-friendly, the service is a little higher than average, and the food is good. But it's nothing special, it is a typical dine-out place, just like any other Denny's-kind-of-restaurant, but Red Robin specializes in burgers. If you come, you will enjoy it, but it will not be something out of this world. If you are in San Diego and you want to taste a SPECIAL kind of burger, go to Hodads :D

Reading the other reviews, I'm beginning to wonder if I was at the right place... Anyway the Red Robin in Plaza Bonita was a serious disappointment.   Seriously. A big disappointment.  I really wanted to like this place.  I've seen the commercials and thought I was in for a treat--NOT!  My friend who came with me tried to warn me about the food, that we should go some place else, but on her previous visit to this same Red Robin (she came with someone else), she ordered a salad, not a burger, so I still wanted to go and try Red Robin for myself. Well, I ordered the classic cheeseburger, which arrived barely warm and overcooked.  The patty wasn't juicy at all (rather dry).  The cheese was plastered to it, as though it had been sitting under a heat lamp for half an hour.  The lettuce was wilted. The taste was not memorable--was I supposed to season it myself using the Red Robin's Special Blend on the table??  The bun tasted like they just took it out of a bag and threw the over cooked hamburger on it.  It came with the wilted lettuce, tomato, onion, pickle, but nothing on that burger was working in harmony like you'd think it would at a place that claims it serves gourmet burgers.  The steak fries were OK, but no one mentioned anything about them being bottomless--guess I missed out on that one, but you'd think the server would have piped up and offered??  I have to admit that the staff there is very cheerful and pleasant, but perhaps a bit inexperienced.  There was trash on the floor that most of the staff was oblivious to.  After about 40 minutes, one guy actually saw the litter and stopped to pick it up.  No one even asked how the meal was or anything.  I probably should have just sent the burger back and asked for a fresh one, but oh well...  Needless to say, I'll follow my friend's lead next time and won't return.  I could have gotten a much better burger at Carls Jr. for half the price.
went there yesterday  evening, service was fast, waiter very niece, food was ok, drinks a little weak to my taste, i'll be back not any time soon, was very pricey to me.
always enjoy this place. i try a new burger each time and haven't been disappointed yet.

Red Robin has a decent variety of juicy burgers along with some other items that pretty much suits everyone's taste buds. For people who don't want beef, there's chicken or veggie alternatives. Red Robin is also aware of people who are trying to watch their figures and offer healthy wraps & salads. However, when I go to this place, I throw my diet out the window to dive into the juicy guacamole bacon burger. Another burger that I absolutely loved was a cheeseburger that had all the fixings with an egg in the middle.. You may think it's weird just like i thought at first, but you must try! Also, some of the meals come with bottomless steak fries. Usually, i prefer thin fries over thick.. But these are definitely a winner because they're crisp on the outside & tender inside. I love to sprinkle the Red Robin seasoned salt that you'll find on every table, along with their tasty ranch. I love their ranch.. It tastes so good with lots of flavor! The service was pretty good as well.

High prices for generic food. Plus the check came as soon as our food was served. Did not feel very welcoming. Maybe I wanted dessert? The staff was not very well informed regarding the menus. When I brought my concerns to the attention of the manager he told me the staff is aims to give the customer the gift of time? Time to do what I have no clue. I brought my concerns to the attention of the company and was once again referred to the same manager. I do not recommend this location.

our server was rude and never gave us our refills so we gave him a small tip and when he came to pick up the check he looked in it and said thanks a whole bunch guys... very sarcastically and stormed away.  food was ok. probably wont go back and it was pricey.
the burger was pretty terrible... after i made a complaint about it they promptly fixed it and it as delish as usual

I guess my first experience back here after years was just so good that I had to leave a review. Well, last week I came here with a bunch of friends and my burger was incredible. Had a fresh beer with it and endless steak fries to make it complete. In addition, the New York Knicks game was on the huge screen TV right in front of me. I'll definitely keep coming back!

This is a good thing. I don't give my 4th star out to lightly however this was a good Burgers and fries. Now I don't expect much form a burger joint however this one surprised me. 1st they had gluten free buns and the meat can as I liked it red. I was thinking they would over cook it but the cook did not over cook it. Ya ya.   Now as for the fries they were not over cooked that was a surprise as well and they were not bad tasting as well. The services this is always tricky one because some are good and bad now I did notes that they don't like to answer you when you call. I seen the manger walk by and he did not answer keep walking though that was odd then he came up a little later and ask how it was going. Ok that is just stupid. Now our waitress was grate and she even though the others waitress would not answer us but there was one that would other then our waitress was a good waitress that was nice of her.&??

Let me preface this by saying that I dont usually eat burgers, so I'm certainly hard to please when it comes to getting my order right. I got a margarita which were so good that I got a second round (especially since I don't normally drink, that's pretty big deal.)  I only like mushroom burgers without anything but the patty, cheese & mushroom plus I asked for extra mushroom & today I was served the perfect burger with a mountain of mushroom. (Bear in mind extra mushrooms meant that the bread would get soggy, but that's my own doing - besides I don't usually eat all of the bun anyways) Kudos to the server tonight (& I wish I had paid attention to her name, cuz she was great) so I have say getting my order right is definitely worth a mention. ... and of course Bottomless fries, which I like fat potatoey fries.  It's kickoff night so naturally it was loud, but not too busy & paying the check on the machine thing made it really easy to just get up & go. There's ample parking around the mall, or accessible by multiple bus routes. Locating the restaurant can be a bit tricky, it's upstairs by the food court & you actually have to walk outside to get to the front door.  Other than that I've never had a bad experience at this Red Robin.  Well done Management team!  Cheers

When I came here last weekend it was pretty crowded and we had to wait about 15 to 20 minutes to be seated, but I will admit I did like the food way more than I thought I would. I had the "bees knees" chicken sandwich and it was delicious even when I ate half of it as leftovers when I got home.

I wanted to celebrate my birthday here with my family bc this place has the best food and great customer service. Vanessa was our severe she was really nice and very helpful great customer service! Thank you Vanessa!

My daughter and I went to Red Robin this evening.   This was the second bad experience at this particular Red Robin.   Last time the service was nothing short of terrible.   This time my burger was bad.   I ordered the "wedgie burger" and when I began to cut it noticed it was well done.  I specifically ordered as close to medium rare as possible.  I understand RR doesn't cook medium rare but what about medium?   This burger had hockey puck status it was so over cooked.   It was barely lukewarm, my bacon was cold, and looked like it was the microwave brand.   What's worse, I began cutting the burger to eat and it looks like it was a frozen patty that one would purchase from Costco or Sam's Club.  Very disappointed.   If I wanted a fake microwave processed burger, I could have done that at home for less money.   Will not return.

I came here for pickup and the service sucked. There was this young man at takeout but he was hardly there, i believe he was in the kitchen grabing orders and getting them ready. This poor lady was already waiting for her order before i got there and my order came out first( yay for me but i felt bad for her) The hosts are there and its not like theyre talking to each other but they dont really aknowledge people unless theyre for dine in. The takeout area needs a person to be helping out, it took 7 min for me to get aknowledged.

I don't know why this place has such a low star count. I have had really great service here, our server was also the bartender and he was so nice! I had a pins colada and it was boozy and sweet! Plus the price for the drinks are so affordable!  The burgers are really yummy and inexpensive as well! Sign up for their rewards program you'll get a free burger on your birthday and discounts throughout the year!  Don't say I didn't tell you! Give em a chance and I'm sure you'll enjoy it!

Super bad service, cold fries, no bacon on the burger that lists it, really dirty bathroom. My daughter's burger even had weird green goo on the bottom of her bun. This used to be one of our favorite chains, but this was the worst.

We went on Wednesday night, 8 p.m.  When we went in, there was no one up front, except a customer with a stack of togo containers.  It was at least 5 min before someone arrived, who looked like the manager.  He did not acknowledge us at all, and immediately addressed the man with the togo food.  It was obvious that this was not going to be settled quickly.   He should have asked the man to wait, or called another employee to help.  Instead he left us standing there, waiting, and still no acknowledgement.  Finally, he offered to seat us, nearly 15 min after we arrived.  He then took us a direction toward tables, but then discovered they were unseatable and reversed.  He wandered in another area and then asked another employee to take us to a table around the corner..   This type of customer service continued. A server came and asked for a drink order.  We got waters and she left.  I then flagged her down and asked if we were supposed to order on the screen which is on the table, because no one had asked for our order.  She said no and took our order.  The food came out from Jose, who was bustling around very busily.We had asked for silverware when we ordered, and still had none.  he said he would get it, and then went and had another order at the window.  There were FOUR female servers standing there doing NOTHING, including the one who took our order.  They did not lift a finger to help, and we still had no silverware, or napkins. Jose was running around helping others furiously, and eventually got us our silverware.  The servers stood there doing nothing and never checked on us.  Jose was attentive and friendly.   I had wanted mustard and lettuce and tomato, but since Jose seemed to be the only one doing anything I didn't ask.  The first set of fries and cole slaw were very good, but the refills were not.  Slaw was almost sauceless and fries were overcooked.  Burgers were very good, but I needed more toppings and didn't want to ask because of the service inconsistency.   We were charged for a "game" that I had declined, and had to have it removed.  I don't appreciate having to use the computer to pay myself and type all of the needed info, that's what servers are for, and why I eat out and not at home. I might try it again.  They need a lot of training on what customer service is, including the manager.  Bathroom was dirty. Jose was great.
I was being served by a man named Allen. He was nothing but rude to me at the bar. He gave me nothing but attitude and ruined my experience. Simply unacceptable for the customer service industry.

If you know Red Robin, then you know about the bottomless fries and Freckled Lemonades. I've never had anything I didn't like on the menu, but tend to lean on my regular order: A1 Peppercorn Burger, no tomato, garlic fries.  This particular visit I had a great server who made sure we were tended to often, and mindful of a movie we were going to see at AMC. She even brought out the second wave of garlic fries so my friend could indulge. I was impressed.. and that's uncommon. All in all, this staff has always been super friendly and prompt!
The best service really great customer service hands Down I wanna thank my. Server name irie you made our night thank you very much again

We waited and no one was there to seat us, then when someone did come. We asked if we could be be seated and she didn't say anything, she just picked up something from under the desk and left. Customer service sucks.

another long lunch break and my work crew returned here...i ordered the same thing as last time...cobb salad... it was tasty...chicken was cooked nice and had a good flavor. my only complaint is that it was on a small plate vs the giant bowl...no room to move the salad around (mix up the toppings)...everything just kept falling off the plate.  service was nice parking is easy
Food was great. Service was sub par. This place is great for groups as evident in the numerous birthday celebrations occurring simultaneously.
Great burgers, great selection other than burgers, great service and prices!  What else can make your experience any better? Great job Red Robin!

I never have to worry about getting a good burger when I visit this location, but today I got my order and the burger was cold enough that the cheese on top wasn't even melted.......just when I decided to just not bother to eat it a manager walked up to me and asked if he could make me another burger....I hesitated because I really hate to complain....he fixed the problem with wonderful customer service. Made my day.... thank you sir in the red shirt that came from the back......wish I would have gotten your name

It was a rainy busy night, so we understood the wait time  to get a table. Wasn't a problem! Once we got a table , it was yucky dirty, like try a lil harder to wipe off the crud?  Our waiter was super busy, understood and could see it oozing outta the poor dude, but when he got to the table no hi hello, welcome - Nada, a what do you want for drinks? No Ok cool , thanks after we gave him the drink order- kinda odd and not personable in the slightest.  It took another 15 minutes for him to circle back for us to order our meals and when he did, I sh*t you not - He said - What do you want, Do you even know what you want yet? Haha, whoa bro, I feel ya on that tuff night for you, but step it up a bit. If this is your livelihood and you need those tips, don't fake the funk but don't be a d*ick to my family.  We placed our orders and he was on point with delivering the non stop baskets of fries for the table.  On to the meals - Mediocre at best. I asked for no lettuce, shredded lettuce to me is gross and it was covered in the stringy gross'ness. ok I can get passed that lil thing, but my boyfriends grilled cheese, was only grilled on one side and wasn't a gooey cheesy yummy filled sandwich. It was a half assed hard funky nasty cheese mess. Grandmas cup of soup wasn't even luke warm, was cold - granted she didn't care, come on man- leave it under that heat lamp a lil longer to at least let the cheese on top melt somewhat! My kiddo had their version of fish an chips - overly oily and not good. Her apples and majority of the cod landed under her highchair. Don't think we will ever go back to this establishment. It just seemed like they could careless. So well, we could careless about your restaurant.  Oh and PS By The Way - the only reason I left you a good tip, was because of the mess my kid made on the floor and I should of just gave that money right on over to your busser - who was much more gracious than said lame-o server  The End.

I went to Red Robin for the first time. It was my friend's birthday. We had great service and the food was really yummy. I highly recommend getting the garlic fries. The Magic Cookie Shake was really good with a nice cookie crunch. Jose was our server and he was always there to help us. I gave him a pretty good tip. It rare to go some where and the waitress or waiter are always there to help you.

Keep the fries coming please! It keeps my little one busy and it means I don't have to buy him his own food that I know he won't finish anyways. Yes, that's right. Burgers come with bottomless fries and they were always nice and hot, not like they've been sitting on the kitchen counter waiting to be picked up. Just add a little seasoning OR dip em in Ketchup or BBQ sauce since they didn't even taste like they had a little salt on them.  Happy hour is from 3-6. Not a big menu but it's good enough. We ordered 2 full sized wings (Buffalo and BBQ) and also the Spinach and Artichoke Dip for 50% off. The wings came with some chips underneath them and the Spinach and Artichoke Dip was a little sour for me. Didn't enjoy that too much. I did however, enjoy my Reb Robin Burger with a side of BBQ Sauce. YUM! And took some Crispy Chicken Salad from my momma! Made me wish I had the Salad more. Maybe next time!

I was disappointed with my overall experience. On a Sunday night, my two friends and I thought to head over to Red Robin's to satisfy some burger cravings and when we arrived we were rudely greeted and were told the wait would be 30min. The wait was fine, we spent the time inside the mall to keep busy. When we arrived after we had been notified of a table ready for us, we had to wait an additional 10 minutes. We were seated and got on with the ordering. Our waitress was nice but our food... Well that's a different story!! Our bottomless steak fries were hard, unseasoned, and cold. Our burgers didn't taste freshly made, and the overall wait time for our food was too long for what we ordered. I ordered the BBQ chicken sandwich and it didn't have enough barbecue sauce which left the burger bland. The only upside I had to this experience was their freckled lemonade which is an all time favorite of mine.  This place used to be of great quality and after this experience I can say that they're definitely lacking. But nonetheless, thank you to our server, Loralei, for her genuine efforts at keeping us content.

Absolutely disgusting!!!  The food, service and overall cleanliness of the restaurant was horrible. Food: we order 2 of the tavern specials which allegedly had siracha however they both had no flavor and contained so much water as if they had been sitting in a broiler so long that the buns were soggy! We also ordered a signature black and blue burger which used to be my favorite...until today!My medium-rare cooked burger was fully pink inside. More like rare (not even medium rare). The black and blue burger had no flavor and was also was dripping wet; to the point my lettuce was wilted and my bun was soggy. Not juices just water!  Service: we waited patiently for our food which took a while as the waitress never followed up. We were never asked how our food was or if we needed anything.  And to top it all off: We were never asked if we needed more endless fries, therefore we asked for more fries being that our burgers were so horrible, and to our surprise the table (which was sat after us) received their endless fries but we were told sorry we are behind on fries and it may take a while. Cleanliness: the bathroom was cleaner than the sitting area which had crumbs, fries and broken crayons under the freshly buffed tables.  We won't be back,  and I would recommend that everyone reconsider before eating here.  In and Out is more gourmet with better quality food and service!

Our service today was not very good.  We had actually had two waitresses, the second took over the first, and the waitress ( Iridiana) was not a very good waitress.  It was a Sunday and it was busy, but the service was not acceptable, to the point I doubt I'll go in to any other Red Robin in San Diego or in general.   Ordered an Appetizer (chili cheese fries).  They're weren't bad, but no plates, utensils or NAPKINS!  We had to ask for some and by the time they brough them, our appetizer was almost done.They also didn't give my daughter her apple juice in a timely manner.  When it came time to check out, the waitress tried to be nice and social (too late), telling us about the survey (which I didn't do).  I shouldn't of tipped, but I did anyways.  On the portable pay kiosk they leave on the table, it asked for I think 20 percent, I lowered it to 10 percent or maybe a slight bit more than 10 percent.  I don't recommend this place, WORK ON YOUR CUSTOMER SERVICE!!  I used to work in customer service and I did a pretty decent job at it, you guys seriously need some work.  Our first waitress wasn't bad, the second waitress was bad.  Won't be coming back and I don't recommend dining here.  Go elsewhere.

Just arriving in San Diego, starving as we try to hurry into town, this was the first restaurant we found.   The waitress must have noticed to hangry look on my face and felt the urgency to feed me because she promptly took our orders and brought out fries immediately for us to snack on while waiting for our burgers.  I thought it was awfully thoughtful of her to do so.  The dinner was juicy and oh my god, the onion rings were nice and crunchy!

Thoroughly unimpressed. Came here because I found out they had poutine (I've been on a poutine hunt). The ingredients should all meld together into a delicious stack of fries covered in gooey melty yumminess, but this wasn't the case at all. The fried cheese curds did not mesh well with the rest of the plate. The gravy was some bland generic brown variety. My girlfriend got a veggie burger that fell apart and didn't have much taste. Won't be back!

So I haven't been to this restaurant probably ever since it's been built at the mall. We went in with a big party for a birthday and our server was Joseline. Man from the get go this girl was kind and handled the big party like a breeze. Not once getting frustrated but did an amazing job and has everyone's orders correct. The food was actually pretty good as well. I liked the atmosphere it was very family oriented and the manager kept checking on us as well. Overall a very good 1st time experience and Joselines amazing customer service made the visit perfect. Will be back :)

Planning to go to El Torito for lunch, but found the Plaza Bonita store closed.  Next door, Red Robin became Plan B.  We were greeted and seated immediately.  The restaurant was fairly empty. My wife ordered the Honey-Dijon Wings-N-Chips appetizer ($9.00) and was very pleased with it.  She offered me a wing and it was pretty good.  However, the chips had soaked up the wings dressing, and were soggy.  Probably not a good idea to serve them in a bowl together. My Red Robin Chili Burger ($10.39) was at best, average.  The burger patty was fine, but the chili smothering it was far too simplistic in taste:  Just chili powder and raw onion.  The fries were awful.  Not very warm at all, and leathery.  Obviously old, hard, reheated fries.  I pointed this out to our server, (by clanking a fry on my drink glass) and he offered a bowl of fries to go.  Nope, just wanted to inform you how awful the fries were.  Left most on the plate. Herllien, the server was fine.  The fries were the pits.  We'll avoid this place in the future.

Very very good! The burger meat had a delicious flavor with the cheese melted on top of it, the fries were mouth watering. Service was great, we walked in and were warmly welcomed to a table swiftly, I have to say, their original seasoning was amazing, 10/10 would recommend!

Today's experiance was exceptional!  The wait for our booth was about 8 minutes, not bad.  Our server James was AMAZING.  He was very attentive and on his game today.  He made sure his guest were well taken care of and made sure no one's drinks fell below empty.  James has set the bar up high for all RedRobin locations. If I was the district manager,  I would promote James to a manager right away!  Don't let this guy get away..  p.s.  his Piña Colada are on point.

Janicia is one of the best waitresses ever!!! She brought me what I wanted 3 separate times during the meal before I could even ask for it. I wish she could be my waitress at every restaurant!! This location is very good too I have been here many times and never left unhappy.
Had mac and cheese. Was cold, dry, and completely tasteless. A really lousy experience. I wouldn't recommend this place.

location: Carmel Mountain Ranch, San Diego, CA
review: I like this place... delicious burgers especially the A1 burger. always have to order the onion rings tower and share it with the table. don't forget to become a member and start earning your free burgers (especially if you are a frequent flyer of this establishment)

We came for dinner here since my bestie loves hamburgers. We arrived and waited about 5 minutes to be seated. We had the chili cheese fries and pretzel bites as appetizers and both were great. Our food and appetizers arrived in a timely manner. My burger was delicious but the bottomless fries seemed to be counted on my plate, Like someone was counting how many fries was on my plate. Overall good experience, however we kept having to remind our server to refill our drinks

Food was really good, but the services , is been one of the worse One I have experienced in a while, the host seen really upset, she forgot to put our name down, told us in 15 mins, and it took 30 minutes to get a table. Btw her name was Olga.

This establishment provided great service. I forgot the waitress's name but she definitely provided great customer care. Always checking up on us and asking if we need anything, refilling our drinks, and giving us good feedback on what to order. For appetizers we got the fried pickles and onion rings and they were spot on.

My review hasn't changed much after the second visit. We went in and were greeted and seated as one would expect to be. I forget what it's called, but I had the one with the jalapeño pepper on top with fried pepper rings inside. I enjoyed it gluten free with an extra burger pattie.

For the first time, I sat at the bar (not just the bar area, but the actual bar) because it was super busy and packed, but there was availability at the bar. Oh my goodness! Now I know where to sit. So much attention from the bartender/server (Mymy I think was her name). We got our food out promptly even though she warned us the wait from the kitchen was reaching 30-40 min. Because the wait time was so long for the food, she made sure to get the bottomless steak fries to us as soon as possible and frequently. High quality service! Such a rare experience from all the times that I've eaten at Red Robin.

I give this place two stars solely because the server was very kind and attentive. If not for her, it absolutely deserved one after today.  I do enjoy lettuce and tomato but for some reason I don't like them in my burger, specifically. I asked the server to make sure they don't include it and she acknowledged. When I got my Burger, I opened it to add some seasoning to it and found tomato and lettuce remnants in it. I picked it out and ate my Burger but it definitely tasted the heck out of what I didn't want in there, in there.  It comes down to laziness. They made the burger and noticed it's not the way I ordered it, and rather than saying "we screwed up. Let's start over," they instead say "oh crap. That wasn't supposed to be in there.... eh, just scrape the top bun and see if they notice." It's fortunate with laziness like that that it wasn't an allergy issue because that could have been SERIOUSLY problematic for somebody. There is no reason any cook should prioritize their disinterest in doing their job over again (especially when they are paid by the hour, not the burger) over providing their guests with the great tasting experience they asked for and paid for. He not only robbed me of that satisfied experience, he also robbed me of the opportunity to brag on this about what a good job he (could have) did.  I tipped the waitress well anyway because again she wasn't the issue by any means. The scrapped food was an indication that the error was in fact not on her. But consider my gears grinded with Red Robin.

I was here this past Sunday for lunch, 7 and 2 children and the service was very poor, she took for ever to take our drink order, and even longer bringing the drinks, then finally our food was served after 45 minutes of waiting, pretty simple dish, I had the honey mustard chicken bites, way to much honey on a layer of simple chips, my $4.50 Rasberry Lemonade taste like Strawberry Fanta soda, will not be back sorry :(

Discusting food( adult mac and cheese) service was absolutely terrible, horrible!! I've been a restaurant server for 8 years and I never experienced such a bad series of unfortunate customer service . Over all I give this place a negitave -3 stars. It's THAT bad

This place used to be decent, they got great potential unfortunately the service lately is ruining this place. My visit yesterday had the following issues: 1) Lady brought me my lemonade, tasted like tap water, had a strong chemical smell and taste, I asked her to replace it, she took my cup and never returned. 2) Another lady brought my my lunch, asked her to bring me my lemonade which she did after a few minutes and it had the same taste and smell as if they filled it out with the garden hose, no one was coming so I turned the call service button then the light started blinking, 3 employees went by it and ignored it, finally she came and asked her to replace it. 3) I started eating my dinner with no drink since it was getting cold, my son requested fries and ketchup, finally the drink arrived after I was almost done with my dinner and this drink finally tasted normal. 4) I was so thirsty I was hoping to get my refill, but no one came, and again we got forgotten since my son never got his fries or ketchup. 5) We just got fed up, our appetite was ruined, we payed our $50 for 3 hamburgers!, and requested my receipt via email, guess what? I never got my receipt :( Terrible service, next time ill just go to Islands on Eastlake, ill forget about Red Robin the way they forgot about us multiple times.

The burgers are delicious. I haven't had one I haven't liked. The  royal red robbin burger is superb if you like yolk in your burger. The fries are the best..the staff here isn't always the best but it hasn't been too bad where I won't go back.

Love the speed and friendly service. We ordered 5 burgers and received them nice and hot. My dads burger was actually mixed once with another table. They promptly replaced it with a new one. The waitress was kind and accommodating. We come here roughly once a month and always enjoy our time here

So we come here every once in a while...  This most recent trip was on a weekday for a late lunch, around 1pm.. It wasn't busy at all, seated right away at the booth of our choice..  Our server was friendly and checked on us often..  They have a pretty large menu, mostly burgers.. And they are very accommodating to substitutions and special requests...  Their onion ring tower is pretty popular. Thick cuts of onion, came out hot. Comes with 2 dipping sauces.  Their pretzel bites were pretty good. The cheese sauce was a touch too running, I'd like the cheese to stick a bit more, but it had a nice subtle beer taste to it.  I got the bonsai burger this time around.. The patty is a nice juicy size.. And I like the teriyaki taste.. I didn't care too much for the pineapple though, a personal preference.. Husband got their special Oktoberfest burger, I forgot the exact name.. But it has sausage and candied bacon on it.. Any burger with their candied bacon is a score.. These burgers are a decent size and come with "bottomless" steak fries which can also he substituted for a healthier choice.. But I stuck with the steak fries and requested it to be "extra crispy" and it was just that, super crispy on the outside, soft inside.  Kids got the corn dog bites with fruit. Nice crunch to the batter.  We got a mud pie for dessert to share. That thing is big enough for 4... Basically a super rich chocolate ice cream cake. Very indulgent.  Their milkshakes and speckled (strawberry) lemonade are also good choices...

Great hamburgers! I think the fries are yummy, couldn't get enough! The server was so sweet she got me another hamburger even though I accidently ordered the wrong one. She didn't even charge me for it. Amazing customer service!!!

This is a good thing. I don't give my 4th star out to lightly however this was a good Burgers and fries. Now I don't expect much form a burger joint however this one surprised me. 1st they had gluten free buns and the meat can as I liked it red. I was thinking they would over cook it but the cook did not over cook it. Ya ya.   Now as for the fries they were not over cooked that was a surprise as well and they were not bad tasting as well. The services this is always tricky one because some are good and bad now I did notes that they don't like to answer you when you call. I seen the manger walk by and he did not answer keep walking though that was odd then he came up a little later and ask how it was going. Ok that is just stupid. Now our waitress was grate and she even though the others waitress would not answer us but there was one that would other then our waitress was a good waitress that was nice of her.&??

Red robin.... YUUUUM!  Came in for my FREE birthday burger and our service was great! Got seated quickly and our waitress was attentive making sure we were doing well.  I'm in love with the royal red robin burger because the fried egg makes it so much better! I've been here multiple times and haven't had any problems with the service or food.

Red Robin is one of our fave go to burger spot in SD. In this location they're at Plaza Bonita mall in National city.  We love the variety of their gourmet burgers, yummy appetizers (hmmm mouthwatering towering onion rings !) and entrees.  Fave salad is the Insane Romaine Salad hmm my foodie crush. It was insanely delicious! Grilled salad and grilled chicken ! Nom nom nom kind of healthy. Must order!!! Good portion.  Kiddos love their milkshakes and freckled lemonades. Bottomless beverage ! Can't beat that ! They also have soups,wraps and Sammies !  And French fries are endless and tasty !  Love their craft beers and cocktails.  You gotta try the new ginger ale beer with 5.9 alcohol it was delish ! Sweet taste! Overall, great vibes! Nice decor. Good CS. Can't complain !  Coming back soon to try the red ramen burger ! Only for a limited time ! I'm curious let's try it !  Oh my! I'm hungry now lol,  Highly recommended !!! Yum!

Walked in on a Friday night (family of 5) at 10pm (close at 11pm)  Got seated quickly and very politely. Food was great and service was on point. The wife's burger was missing the bleu cheese that came with it but they were quick to correct the issue after bringing it to their attention.  Would definitely go back based on the service we received. Red Robin...Yum!

The la jolla location is way better   This location in chula vista in plaza bonita mall takes forever to seat you even if there isn't many customers in the resturant. We have been here about 15 times and regret coming here every time. It also takes forever for the waitress to take your order. I've been to Red Robin about a handful of times in my life, not because of how amazing it is, but because I just want to go. Does that make sense? I don't crave it, per se, but if the name appears or a commercial plays, then I want to go. I don't think the advertisers are doing a good job... I just believe that I want to go because the gaps in between visits to this place are literally at least a year apart.  My favorite part about Red Robin is the unlimited strawberry freckled lemonade--it even comes in a cool cup! I would probably come here just for that drink, to be honest. Their burgers, though, let me talk about that... I'm going to speak about my latest experience because 1.) it was most recent and 2.) I don't really remember the other times. So, my boyfriend and I went to go here for linner (lunch-dinner) because I wanted a booger that wasn't too far from where we were. He had never gone either, so I thought "Why not?" I ordered the "royal red robin" because I saw it had egg, which I love, and he had the "guacamole bacon" because he didn't want to copy me (plus he wanted guac!)  Our server, who was a nice and attentive girl, asked us how we wanted our patty cooked--pink or no pink. I said, "No pink," while he said the opposite. When our burgers came out, my boyfriend's burger was pretty cooked through, except for a minimal portion. He wasn't picky about it, but he wished it had been more pink. I liked my burger, though. The yolk broke all over it, which was yummy! I was disappointed in the amount of fries the both of us received. When I used to go here, I remember getting a lot a lot a lot of fries! Nowadays, it literally looks like there a 10 fries with my burger. I get that they're unlimited, but come on now... I can finish those fries in a minute. For $.99 more, i upgraded my steak fries to garlic herb fries. Yes, they were good, but I feel like there wasn't garlic and herb to work with.
